1STVNKBPNTOOp-w_zY0kfQ.text: Great food and service! Had the vegetarian frittata and it was great. Also recommend the pastries! Actually, everything I have tried is very good!

WqwXzo6GVZ9aR4eYyaxGZA.text: I spent 5 days in Vegas & stopped here most days. Great fast casual option for delicious fresh food. Everything was quality from the Italian roast coffee to the healthy salads & smoothies & the indulgent pastries. The pineapple kale smoothie is a tasty way to get your greens & the lemon ricotta cookies were divine. Be sure to use the check-in offer to taste your first ones. You'll be back for more. I personally love the lemon ricotta cookies. She makes amazing sandwiches and has a yummy pasta salad. If you like trying a good cocktail or decent wine her bar is for you. Right next to the bistro their is a gift shop that sells signed cookbooks and other Giada merchandise. Overall, this restaurant is a great place for a quick bite, but if you are a foodie like me her restaurant Giada at the Cromwell is a special treat that is worth the price.

tizM6CjknFyINeIRlKOuTg.text: Amazing! Great vibe, wine and AMAZING SERVICE. Beautiful and clean spot. We will be back. Thanks for everything Brenda.

7SbY4VhvfFfdwaNWh9jUBA.text: 1 Star is for the "not so Pronto" service. I'm staying in Ceasars Palace. Long line at Starbucks so I decided to try this place. I don't understand waiting for almost 20 minutes for a large black coffee and 2 chocolate croissants. I finally got my orders as soon as I complained about the wait. This place should change their name from Pronto to "Despacito".  Need to re-examine your service if you want to keep your name Pronto. Chocolate croissant tasted good but it's not worth waiting 20 minutes.

SlY_OIhWLw2y7xpddqwP9g.text: SUCH A FAN!!   Not to throw myself under the bus but...I really did not know who Giada was. I LOVE to eat...but I do not really pay attention to who cooks my food. My husband and I went to Vegas for un'corked and I guess Giada was in town as well since she was part of the event. When we walked in the restaurant to get a gelato...she was there...behind the counter and my husband started fangirling over how happy he was and.....I said to him "who is Giada? who is he?" *facepalm* I was at her restaurant and had no idea who she was.   So next day I returned to her restaurant for a breakfast sandwich. I ordered the Antipasti breakfast sandwich and her kale smoothie. The minute I took a bite of her sandwich, I instantly became her fan. I never in my life had such a fluffy egg!! Everything about the sandwich was PERFECT! Every bite I took, I got more and more lost in the fluffiness of the egg and it had the perfect portion of the meat as well! I went back the day after to get the Spinach and Egg sandwich and it was equally as good.   12 dollars for a sandwich is little pricey BUT it is worth every penny. I cannot wait to try allll her restaurants!

DAiXgRU8q5EPsmjTrd8seA.text: Fast food grade food at fine dining prices.  I got the Canner Chicken Panini and it was similar to something you can get at Starbucks but 3 times the price.

P43LfQB9eblG108OU8pJ-w.text: I loved the service here.  I did not get the persons name who helped us. She told us she was from the Philippines. She was helpful and patient while we placed our order. If you read this review, You Rock!  Thank you for helping us!  Also, most importantly, the food was great!  -2 Stars   Price and portions:  At $18 for a panini, the restaurant should provide sides to a company the sandwich. I couldn't help but feel a bit cheated when I received was my sandwich in a small white bag.    Come on, Giada!  Give us more bang for the buck!  Next time we'll make the walk to the food court and get Tacos.

1HHWIxEgY-6Ohdpp7CDjlQ.text: Expensive but EVERYTHING in Vegas is, still had to take off one star for that  Good coffee Nice bagels Nice fruit cup  My daily bfast after going to a few other places in the hotel that were a bust ie Brioche etc

No hello, thank you or instruction on where to grab my food even after I tipped him.   The place is cute and ambience is nice.  Same feel as Giada's other place in be Cromwell, looks good but underperforms on the food.  I wouldn't come back.

FSZ4qAl-psybbetgaY56kg.text: This was a fresh and inviting spot in the back of Ceasar's. There's a retail area with everything a fan of Giada could desire to purchase, a full bar with hightop seating, and a to-go counter where you can order an espresso, pastries, and a few other light bites. It's a 3-fer!   I ordered an almond milk latte, ham and cheese croissant, and grabbed a banana. Last minute add-on was the lemon ricotta cookies. The almond milk latte was creamy and rich but I wasn't a fan of the croissant. Although it was flaky and buttery, the cheese was goat #notafan and the fillings were small in comparison to the size of the pastry. The real winners were those cookies. As an LV local, I would make a trip back for those pronto!   See what I did there?

This resultant was named in "where" as a top pick for breakfast.  But it could t be further from the best. My husband and I spent $50 on an antipasto sandwich, hashbrown, oatmeal and drinks. They nuke the food.. it was rubbery and way over seasoned. Price is too much too. Could have gone to a nice sit down breakfast place. Do not recommend.

I got the $15 Lobster Roll that's already prepped in their refrigerated section. And it's literally one of the most delicious lobster rolls I've had. I seriously couldn't believe how fresh the flavors were.  They have hot and cold sandwiches and salads made to order. Also displayed is a great selection of pastries.  Folks also stop in here for a more Giada-styled coffees and lattes.  If you're attending a conference at the convention center and need a quick bite. Stop by here. Service is highly efficient as well.

4-dp63UacwP3PDu0k4xaXg.text: I'm in Vegas probably 12-20 weekends a year, and tend to stay, eat, and play only at Caesars family of properties.  In my opinion, the food, service, location, and vibe is hands-down the best at Giada.  I love this place.  Their meat and cheese appetizer is a great variety, and decently well priced.  They have a changing menu, that always has a great pasta dish (the Cheese wheel is unique and worth the 64$ cost.. it's for two, and is awesome.  Add some crushed red pepper tho!). The Cavatelli is also amazing, and has a light pesto sauce.  Small portion, but so tasty.   And for lunch I recommend the lemon and pesto panini.  The chef really cares, and even came to our table last trip to make sure our order was correct (I miscommunicated a special order...) and was incredibly sincere.  The staff is friendly, not pretentious, and the location is unbeatable.  Get there early for a table with a view of the fountains.   Keep up the great job, Giadas.

aelI6FZcc4QTfVt5WB6elQ.text: Loved the breakfast here. For $29.00 you get coffee of your choice, cappuccino for me, freshly made omelettes, fresh fruit, pastries and Giada's lemon ricotta cookies. The panna cotta was flavorless and gelatinous. Not worth it.   The lemon ricotta cookie were good get them if you decide to go.

CvjTws6o-ikcV47JlG023A.text: I absolutely loved the lemon ricotta cookies.  So delicious!  Tiramisu was delightful.  I got the soup of the day...which was not very good at all...but maybe I shouldn't be ordering soup here?   Overall, I'll be coming back...I've got to try that muffuletta

maD22kEXLFw38i-Kzc6vKQ.text: Came here for lunch while at a work conference.  Note:  this is not Giada's full-service restaurant - it's the fast food spot.  I'm pretty sure that place will be a much different experience than mine in terms of food.    Summary:  For the money, you can have a better meal.  My guess is Giada would tell you to try the full-service restaurant.  Ambience:  pretty cool - modern and bright with a splash of color - it's a nice departure from the rest of the Caesar's aesthetic.  Having the wine bar next door is a nice touch.  Service:  it's more fast-foody (go through a line), but the food looks pretty great.  The service was friendly but fast-foody, nothing bad, but nothing to really write home about.    I had the steak with roasted vegetables.  Here's what threw me off: -They heat up the meat in fancy microwaves, and it came out well-done.  If that was a possibility, I wish I had a chance to specify medium rare.  The roasted veggies were cold...but they're roasted, shouldn't they be hot?  And the food was served in plastic containers (even though it wasn't to-go).  None of this is a problem if I'm spending $10-15...but this was a $45 meal.  For dessert, I had the cheesecake cannoli (they have a gelato cannoli option).  This was well executed for my taste - not too cream-cheesy, the shell was not too thick...nicely balanced.  I also bought some cookies for later...which weren't bad either (the cannoli is the better buy).  This is a restaurant where you walk away feeling like you spent more money than you should have.  Your head will appreciate that it's fresh ingredients, but your taste buds may walk away confused.  It may be just my dish - try the salmon or chicken.  I'd probably save the steak meat for actual steak joints.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cannoli - naace!
Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak - make sure you tell them if you want anything less than well-done.

BdBdiGNo8tsuvWON7iLT_Q.text: While walking around Caesar's Palace I came across a restaurant opened by Giada De Laurentiis. Being the Food Network Chef stalker I am, I wasn't going to pass up a snack here so hopped in line to grab a sandwich and a side of veggies haha.  I ordered a ham, gruyere and apple panini with a side grilled vegetables. The staff was nice and prepared the food no less than five minutes. There were lots of tables up for grabs so my friends and I quickly picked one and began munching.   I really enjoyed the apple and ham combination. The gruyere was present but didn't stand out as much as other ingredients. It's also worth noting the panini has a delicious mustard sauce that also works well with the ham and apples. The grilled veggies had a nice charred flavor and tasted fresh. So fresh that the onion brings tears when eating them. Throw those bad boys back on the grill! LOL...I wouldn't recommend eating the onions alone unless you enjoy the strong flavor and burn but cutting small pieces to eat with the rest of the veggies works just fine.   If you're looking for a hefty meal then I recommend looking elsewhere but if you're looking for a small decent lunch in Caesars, Pronto is the spot. The flavors of what I ordered is enough to prompt another visit if I'm passing through. Eyeing the lobster roll and curried chicken panini for next time.   Lunch 2/11/2018

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled vegetables. Lunch 2/11/3018
Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham, gruyere and apple panini. Lunch 2/11/3018

iBJ60qpEOy06Zevebpr4Bg.text: You may have some sticker shock when you first walk up to Pronto.   But, when you remember that this is a quick joint in a large hotel on the Las Vegas Strip, the prices are not that crazy.  They are akin to airport prices.  So, not cheap (for example, a small cup of berries is $10), but given that you are a captive audience and are either hungry or thirsty, this joint gets the job done fairly quickly and painlessly.  I would say overall it is a 3 star joint.  I am bumping it up a star to 4 because the employees went above and beyond to make me something specific.  I like my fruit smoothies a certain way, and when I travel it is never easy for places to get it right.  I know that I am being a bit unreasonable requesting things be done so precisely, but I am nice about it and a good tipper, so I think that makes up for the annoyance.  Also, if a place can't get it done, I understand.  Pronto's employees were awesome, instead of simply refusing my request and instructing me to order one of the smoothies off the menu or order nothing, they worked with me and put together a smoothie that is pretty close to what I make for myself at home.  One of the women even went to check if they had more blueberries in the kitchen.    This level of service is not always found at quick places like Pronto, and it was appreciated.  Next time I am at Caesars I will definitely be back.

0iLVqRIujUBb2UCj2t5uDA.text: Very fancy, but of course vegas overpriced- in fact, after waiting in a ridiculously long line they then even charged $0.50 more than their advertised price on the boards. When questioned, the cashier first claims it's the tax even though that's clearly not True on the receipt. Then when shown a picture of the board she claims they raised the price and the manager called to have the board changed but they haven't changed it yet...so wrong! watch for your receipts, otherwise you're being cheated everywhere! :(

zbmY3Swr1ZZpvhGbcn16cg.text: This is basically a cafeteria by Giada. The food was slightly above average, but tasted old. The frittata was dry. Also, beware of the unmarked Giada branded items. They are crazy expensive! We were hoping for a little better quality from a Giada place.

jy2pkjaSQUrQgAzYoNBEWQ.text: We stopped by Pronto for a quick, light snack to hold us over while we waited for Bacchanal. Surprisingly, there were a lot of items to choose from and they all sounded delicious. I loved how there was a display of the items in front of you so you could actually see what you're getting! Super helpful for those who are trying to decide between items!   The cashier was very helpful in guiding us towards a yummy smoothie. Pineapple kale, I believe it was, was surprisingly very refreshing and not overly "green". Next visit, I'll try her other recommendation - Almond Date. I also got a small cup of pesto pasta salad - super fresh and tasty. Loved the chunks of mozzarella! And when in Vegas, a coffee at any hour is acceptable. The iced latte was nothing over the top, but it was definitely enjoyable after I added a little agave to it.   It's definitely a nice place to grab a snack while you wait for the buffet. You can see the TVs from the bar and people watch! As with everything on the Vegas Strip, keep in mind that a small snack can still be pretty pricey.

_w2RcfpdAqctGtOmerb1PQ.text: What a pleasant surprise!   I was staying at Caesar's for a business trip and only stopped here to grab lunch to-go because of its proximity to my room's elevator tower. I had low expectations but was pleased to discover that Pronto delivers on more than just convenience.  The Tuscan Steak entree with potatoes as the side over-delivered on both quality and quantity for the price. The steak was cooked and seasoned perfectly, and the potatoes were juicy without being greasy. The complimentary cookies with Yelp check-in were light and moist, with just enough lemon to be zesty but not overpowering.   It's so rare that an in-casino quick service restaurant provides sitdown quality food at fair prices, so Giada, I salute you.

mzG869vIEi3Z-L7DWcUOPA.text: I found this place just randomly one afternoon walking through Caesars Palace....all of a sudden I turn the corner and I see Giada herself there working! As a huge Giada fan, I was fangirling (of course) but also decided to check the place Out.   I got a small latte for $6, a little pricey but I was expecting it to be. I didn't try any of the food options there but I did get a table in the seating area.  This cafe is a super casual cafe in the Caesars Palace. There are slot machines located right across from it. It was a nice spot just to hang out in between activities. This is not a sit down restaurant, so as long as you are aware of that, I think this place is great! Super cute and aesthetically pleasing to the eye. Giada also has products that you can buy as a souvineer as well. As a Vegas native, I would not go out of my way to come to this cafe. BUT if I was visiting and located on the strip, I would come out of my way to check it out for the ambiance and well of course, Giada.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L_YnIwH_CZKiuDWTwoqHQQ.text: Great Service love the juice selection, had a panini sandwich was delicious. Little pricey but hey it's Giada.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watermelon Juice, Toasted Turkey Avocado And Bacon Panini and if you check in thru Yelp you get free Lemon Ricotta Cookies

Z915ftzIY5q3hJhhyQnLdA.text: If Jason is the bartender, sit at the bar. He is amazingly awesome and will take very good care of you! The food is amazing during brunch and the unlimited mimosas is the bets part. Thanks to the best experience!

UbDNQVk6DH233yRXKOGa8A.text: Agreeing with another reviewer: the Italian cake tastes like play-doh! It's  actually mostly the red layer combined with the frosting. The rest is a dense almond cake. But hey, it's moist and other people could like that flavor past the play doh part.   Everything here is of high quality and has a good selection of quick bites. I really liked the lemon ricotta cookies and glad I got the three pack which turns out to be more affordable. They're a soft, fluffy, and lemony cookie- like a little cake round dipped in lemon icing. Yum.

ShsfjXaXeSaFTZIj2M1ujw.text: Not super impressed. The lemon ricotta cookies you get for free with the yelp check in were very good, and saved this place for me. Other than that, the pistachio cannoli I got was soggy and was a disappointment. My co workers peanut butter and jelly dessert wasn't very good either. Nice texture, but the flavors didn't mesh well, surprisingly. Maybe it was an "off" day.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6i5Oe1-fclpfZuO78gSjgw.text: We visited Pronto 3 times during our stay at Caesars Palace--twice for breakfast and once for a glass of wine. If you can get past paying $50 for two sandwiches, hash browns, and 2 large coffees (or, as the case may be, 2 glasses of wine), it's actually really good. Both times there was a line to order breakfast but it moved fairly quickly and the people at the counter and registers were polite and patient. The bartender was also cordial and took the time to explain to my husband and I the region of Italy that our wine was from.   The entire restaurant opens to one of the main drags inside Caesars, which makes for good people watching. Portion sizes for the food were decent.  I would knock off 1/2 a star for being overpriced, but then you could say the same thing for just about any other place on the Strip. So 5 stars it is.

PBTug0c2HLojUV7-8ddBvQ.text: Great service. Brenda was great. Made good drinks and took care of us. Met the manager, Ryan also. Very friendly and made us feel home. Obviously the food was fantastic also.

WUQPDJl6uCqHxrPIOIz2cw.text: Toasted turkey, avocado and bacon. It is a typical panini. Pronto this place isn't. It will be a one stop wonder. And that is sad since I so enjoy eating at Her full restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Toasted turkey, avocado and bacon. It is a typical panini.

KAm_SZco0DJafAIq-7iS7g.text: Enjoyed a cup of delicious coffee, a breakfast sandwich, and some lemon ricotta cookies! The cookies were amazing!

39PFsgzhLoxwyEgIAA6AAg.text: Great service, specifically from Ryan and the food was delicious. A little pricy though.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menus and people along with restaurant

kOQpY3TICoeDhztSFjQCcg.text: I really liked her restaurant at Cromwell so I was excited about this one. I went and then my excitement went away. The workers do not know which way they're going. Two lines was really confusing. Once you think you figured out the line system, they would change it again. The salad was crazy expensive and not good. I even witnessed one salad that had like two slices of bacon on it with leafs just burying it. How could you get full of of that??? You paid for just lettuce lol.   My friends order was forgot about. We waited way too long for a pre-made sandwich. Only two vegan options. The rest of the veggies are toppled with cheese. Missing a lot of clients right there.   I can only hope this place gets better over time because they see a lot of convention customers.

45VS1PNQOxLI2n3_ey0rSA.text: Was worried when I was arrived because of the review but process was smooth. There was no wait or confusion. I ordered my food smoothly and then proceeded to the register to pay. They were actually out of the lemon ricotta cookies and the cashier went out of her way to find me some and get them packaged. We ended up eating at the bar for some drinks and the service was great. The bartender was very attentive and knowledgeable.  The people that complain about the process and service are wrong because we went back a second day to take some goodies back for friends and the process was just as smooth, some people just like to complain so take their reviews with a grain of salt.   I haven't mentioned the food, but it was great. Sandwiches and sides were amazing. I split the grilled cheese and the ham, apple and Gruyere sandwich with my sister they were both amazing and tasty. We had the potatoes and caprese salad to share and they were so light and refreshing, perfect pairing with the sandwiches.  The desserts are amazing, we brought a bunch home to friends who had them a few days later and they were still fresh and delicious.  The wine selections are great.

oKkH53E9lL7l8SWvEn86jw.text: It's really not all that. My husband, parents and I are the hot turkey sandwich called that long name I can't pronounce and then my mom got a cold salad and I got the cold pesto salad which was bland and tasted like the fridge it was in. I wouldn't come back. We spent a ridiculous amount on it I think based on Giada's name. Wouldn't come back.

tIbOcySCitPEsBAtw0Rc1A.text: Love this place. Had a great experience. Special thanks to Drea, she's an amazing server and made our experience perfect. She was attentive, personal, sweet and knowledgeable.  Will come back here every time we are in Vegas!!

HrBv60djAG21Hs3vdhZvFA.text: Wow $5.99 for a regular coffee! I didn't like that every thing was so over priced and the cashier rounded up my items. My daughter order a Frittata and it was so small, not worth the 8.99. Too bad I thought since she is such a good food personality it would be good!

FS7xgncb9WT_1PRBXgCKFA.text: The menu was exactly what we were looking for after a day at the pool. Fresh and light.

bGyBF0BGAucYe6Hg9FuXaA.text: Margarita is a very rude server at the cash register! Be prepared to have a terrible customer services ! She is very unwilling to answer your questions about the food !

Wqn3QpbUQwnoLpURwXLxpw.text: Staff was amazing! We had Sunday brunch and loved everything about it. Everything is fresh and a large variety small bites. Loved the lemon cake, olives we're sensational and the pasta salads we're amongst the favorites. Get a reservation it's so worth it.

wgrvay5dwEKuYrPMZc-gaw.text: Very cute place. Although all foods are pre made. Cake was slightly dry but good flavor.

CT-ZBvicsvrd22PSvrlYiw.text: Awful service and terribly slow which is inexcusable given all the food is 'ready made'. Whilst I know its new the process from ordering to food delivery is awful resulting in missed orders, inaccurate orders, missing items and angry customer after angry customer. I ordered 4 times from here over 3 days and EVERY time they got the orders wrong or missed items. Whilst waiting (too long) I also witnessed dozens of other customers getting the wrong orders or their orders being completely forgotten.   The process needs to change completely....  - They need more people making Paninis  - The order station needs to be closer to the start (so the non english speaking chinese can point to what they want) - They need someone collating orders (as if you order salad it comes from a different section than sandwiches).  - The same person should be collating and checking orders (at least temporarily until they sort themselves out)  The issue is everyone has their station, but NO ONE is pulling it all together.  The issues I witnessed existed whether there was 1 person waiting or 20. Its a fundamental process issue.

uctUUDkRm3GYMNtMee2FkA.text: This is a Great place to eat and the cookies are fantastic.    We always stop in here when we visit Vegas and go for the buffet as well.    The cookies are too good.

dVwsgDL1lLMG8NpZLy1b8A.text: Stayed at Caesars Palace on my last trip to Vegas so this was our go-to spot for a quick breakfast.  Antipasti Breakfast sandwich was delicious and huge.  They did not skimp on the meat!  Easily shareable between two people if you want a quick bite to bring to the pool.  I also tried the pineapple and kale smoothie.  A little too kale forward for me, but still good.  Next time I would try a different smoothie.  Prices are high, but inline with Vegas standards.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ioR5faul00D7bpENEPZJZQ.text: Decent food but pricey. We ordered the Muffaletta and the Lobster Roll, which you can just pick up from the fridge section, except no one told us that so we waited for 15 minutes at the pick up area. I had to ask someone about it order before they told us to just grab it from the fridge.  The Lobster Roll was worth it for $15. But the Muffaletta was only half of a sandwich, which is overpriced at $15.

BxZvxnximXaXySl0GCdcXw.text: The caprese salad was very good. I also enjoyed the stick of organic turkey jerky they had at the counter. I would come back here to try a panini and maybe some wine.

g1B08LVpov8a9Ib5pMHGoQ.text: Sandwiches & yogurt taste great.  The service is fast and the place is neat.  My only concern is their prices are too high.

Zy0n32AMnjjAWhwvBHkXqQ.text: The service is terrible. Extremely rude. So weird, the service everywhere else at the resort is fabulous but the staff here are plain mean.

vy_Kwl159rZksEGk_zQ96w.text: Tasty, quick options while in Las Vegas! The salads are fresh and refreshing. The caprese was rich and fresh. The Cabernet Sauvignon was rich and full of depth. Tiramisu was the bomb. You must check this friendly establishment!

oCxpIlDLbOs_8HTJIKTlIw.text: I'm only giving this 2 stars because the staff was great and fast. The food is mediocre especially for the price point. Another celebrity making an easy buck on their fame

xEAy-iMcrFLiVDaLuL52eA.text: Dry. Unhappy workers. Dry. Overcooked. Not good. We got the grilled chicken, "cheesy" potatoes (zero cheese as u can see) and the antipasto. Not impressed, but will give 2 stars as i got free cookies for checking in. Quick option but definitely not worth the $20, did not satisfy. Also, not one worker would give me a water cup or any water even after i asked 3x!?

gfKRAfHvZelHjGgBiZvysA.text: I got an email saying that my reservation got cancelled. But when I called Cesar's Palace, they told me that there's no phone number to Pronto to even ask. They suggested that I drive there and ask!?!.  I'm going to really drive all the way there to ask why the reservations I made weeks ago got cancelled? We won't even try it out due to the the poor service.

8nMaiTjP9znA1bHNEG72AA.text: My husband and I were in Vegas for my birthday week. Stopped by Ceasars palace and went to Prontos for coffee and dessert. I got really excited when I saw this new place and it was Giadas Cafe. I'm a big fan of Giada's cooking, food and restaurants. I purchased a few goodies to bring back home with me. I loved her ricotta lemon cookies and I also bought her nougant. I didn't open the nougant until I came to my room. I looked at it and relized it was old and expired. I purchased two packs. Please people employee check the dates before you sell me something old to eat. I had to throw them away. It also tasted old. It expired on 2/28/2018 and I purchased it on  3/3/2018. I would have taken it back but we had to leave vegas already.

CuiI0i7AOu6jyFkz2YzIMw.text: Picked up several things here using players points. The breakfast sandwich is very good - generous amounts of egg and ham. The cakes were quite tasty also. Very dense and flavorful.  And the strawberry and banana smoothie was killer. Minus one star for being pricey. But then again, what isn't in Las Vegas.

gX5CHmvP1EJZ8eQIqh4OOw.text: Unfortunately, I have to write this review simply because I got food poisoning from this establishment. I love all of Giada's restaurants including the one in the Cromwell. However, this location needs to be more careful with their foods. I had the lemon grilled cheese sandwich and a couple pastries along with a salad and couldn't leave my room for the next couple days. I've eaten here probably over 100 times and never had an experience like this so I will let you decide for yourself. Just make sure whatever you order is safe! I decided I might give this place another try next time I'm in town (I go about once a month) I will update accordingly.

Jy3hgYzXux8pKYy9gQ4AmA.text: The lemon cookies are to die for!!!  Definitely have to take some home for my son!  My mom is with me and lemon is her favorite

WokJbyP1uBauz8Zgch-Z9A.text: The Lemon cookies are to die for!!!!! If you've never tried them, it is a must! They are so moist and delicious!

z0Q7PIxcoboQ909BR5glAg.text: Always fantastic! The Nutella Stracchiaella gelato is heaven! So smooth, creamy, and delicious! Their iced mocha is lovely. Lemon Ricotta cookies are light and fluffy, with just the right amount of lemon. Can't wait to try more items in the future!

grCRTL-VPU5skqzqOh_wTA.text: Pronto is an amazing little place, sort of a modern, light and of course delicious break from it all. Lemon pound cake is fantastic but the banana pound cake is even better. My wife had an americano coffee and said it was top-notch. The crossaints were also really good and I got a couple extra to take home.  Stop here and have dessert or just a quick bite, you will not regret it!

sXwqSh4UzJdDnJBkqifC1A.text: I enjoyed the BEST lemon and cranberry muffin yesterday. TODAY I received the FREE lemon ricotta cookies for seeing Pronto Giada on Yelp. THANK YOU!!

W24Vsnj8IMXr_tWpXIpTdw.text: The unique rainbow cake and super tasty lemon ricotta cookies are to die for!! I will come back again the next time I'm in Vegas.

akcXz8StFGVpGOVYD1ofqA.text: We enjoyed Pronto! I had the muffuletta and the mozzarella and tomato salad. They were fantastic!! I also had the soup of the day. The counter staff described it as a chicken broth vegetable soup with green beans and rice. It was really like a misso soup with Couscous and a few peas.  It was mostly just broth.  It did not have any other vegetables in it. I probably would not order that again.  The area of Pronto is bright and cheery and clean. Overall, it was a good experience.

Rixi6tJSj2PNKon0lbO_-Q.text: Amazing fresh, tasty and healthy option in the city of sin.  I had the chicken with a side of lentil salad and broccolini.  The coffee was what I needed this morning and tasted better than any Joe from Sbucks; it's Counter Culture coffee.  Can't wait to indulge in a lemon ricotta cookie for dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Ricotta cookies.  So moist and lemony!

tO4ZAkzlGGdrHKu-2uK87g.text: Has delicious coffee! The best chia seed Greek yogurt parfait I have ever had!  They were giving away free lemon scones when you check in. It is also very conveniently located. They have hot food and baked goods along with refrigerated section! Clean and quick!  Wish there was one near our house!

cjjOX4WakAd15k1nwnD6aQ.text: I would have given my review no stars if it was an option so one star it is. My wife and I wanted to get something quick to eat and thought this was a perfect opportunity to try Giada. Well to start I am not going to hold back. The service sucked I was informed by the sandwich maker that due to my order being keyed into the register wrong I had to eat the sandwich and not the fratta we ordered. I informed him we want we ordered and replied take it up with cashier. After waiting 20 minutes to clear up the mess out comes the fratta.  I order a lobster roll which was to have chunks of lobster meat. Well again disappointed the lobster meat was shredded and was a tiny portion as you can see in the photo. The lobster roll was $15 way over priced even for Las Vegas standards. The photo indicates that the plastic knife was larger than the $15 shredded lobster disaster Giada is serving. We couldn't find a fork and when I asked for one I was told when they get a chance someone would fill the empty fork bins. I was told are their spoons and if so use those for now. The restaurant was not busy and now I can see why.  Do not try this establishment unless every other restaurant is closed and the food was free. So disappointed tell your friends to not waste their money or their time.

mw8AvOs_Y9tNw5BGVLutRA.text: We were staying at caesar's palace this weekend. I went to pronto to grab couple of panini I bought 2 panini & cheese cake bottle of water i paid $50 . everything went to trash beside the water . All the sandwiches are premade like seven eleven wrapped in plastic wrap they put it in the machine for 2 minutes wrap it give it to you ,the inside is fozen cold same thing the cheese 2 slices of meat 1 slice of cheese $16.95 each . The cheesecake looked good but no taste its a waste to eat that fattening dessert . Very disappointing I tought its gida's joint it must be good . Never again . I could of gone to gordon ramsey & get the best food ever . Don't look at the pictures that they post that's how they catch you

3HRJuaCanbZjkE8l0oQBpw.text: Having enjoyed the fruits of giada de laurentiis masterful Monday at the cromwell, I expected orgasmic occurrences in my mouth. This did not take place. I found myself utterly dissatisfied much like a wife of a man with no libido. Reservations for 11:30 am. Seated at 1 PM. I arrived to a bar filled with fruit flies and shrimp flies. Room temperature shrimp and 65 degree medium rare beef. I had to stare into the eyes of very sad friends who felt I had let them down with my selection. Bottomless mimosas were in fact bottomful. Manager did not know what to do with his hands. Hostess was also bus boy. I wish I had more hands, so i give this establishment 4 thumbs down. The milk has indeed gone bad. Reluctantly yours... just a guy in vegas

A31pqc9EF2gRw3wJqyV4fQ.text: I go to Vegas monthly and am always trying new places to eat. My visit to Pronto was the worst dining experience I've ever had out of an extremely large amount of trips. I went for the weekend brunch and it couldn't have been any worse. I had a reservation and arrived 10 minutes early. I checked in and didn't end up getting seated until about 10 minutes after my reservation time. They advertise online that they have a variety of fresh squeezed juices and this was one of the main reasons why I went here with my father. I asked what fresh squeezed juices they have and she told me that they have none. I inquired about it and she said they haven't had fresh squeezed juices for awhile and the only juice they have is orange juice but they don't squeeze the oranges and it's bottled. I order an orange juice and an espresso. After 10 minutes the drinks never arrived and another waitress ended up bringing me orange juice. The espresso arrived eventually and was fine. I then try an omelet and some of the meats and other hot food. Everything was cold except for the made to order omelet. Other tables around me were complaining and I heard one lady tell the waitress that this was the worst experience she's ever had in Vegas. She said she ordered a water 2 times and never got it. My waitress was no where to be seen most of the time and a waitress from another section had to step in and get drinks for us and the table next to us. She was more helpful than our actual waitress. After being lured in by their Falsely advertised fresh squeezed juices, being served cold food, and receiving awful service I can honestly say this was the worst dining experience I've had in Las Vegas by far. People all around me were complaining about how awful things were. Very disappointing experience. Avoid this place and dine elsewhere!

0ypQkPp2Ub_gQMKn2b8AZQ.text: A little pricey, but I would go back specifically for the Cobb Salad. It's delicious and the dressing is to die for.   The shop is very cute and there's a couple of wall backgrounds that are very good for photo ops.  If you check in on yelp you'll get free cookies.

yERxImLsIO6eQvBVuZREWA.text: Came here each morning for a latte and cornetti (seems just like a croissant). They have little jars of jam available upon request.   Try the lemon ricotta cookies, which are delicious.  Yes, it is not cheap, but everything in Vegas is expensive. At least the quality is good here.

RMfNhl13AweMNVG5j8ItbQ.text: This is a great place for breakfast! We tried the breakfast brunch which is all you can eat. There are a wide variety of options like orzo, made to order omelettes, smoked salmon with capers and Italian version of pork loin. Unlimited lattes, coffee, juice and cappuccinos are included along with pastries like delicious Nutella bars. Very reasonably priced for the quality and quantity of choices.

b6XiX5l88MIdQunhl8ZCow.text: Ok I'm not one to complain so I hate to do this ....  Today was the first day they opened after an expansion apparently ... they didn't bring enough staff ... so drinks came out much later than you came back to the table with your food. The Saturday Sunday brunch is basically self serve so .. 90% of the food is cold or room temperature ...  the only thing hot was omelet ...  all the meat is room temp ..  also bc it's self serve you get a new plate every time you come up .. they didn't clear our plates ... so imagine a small 2 top with 4-5 plates on it ...  it wasn't great ... I don't know even if they improved these things if I would come back ...

yvNnrGjQ380XJqB-k1jM2g.text: I love Giada but this place is very much overpriced. I believe its bc of its location and being in Vegas.. the signature Mufuletta was just alright, I've had much better Italian sandwiches at $7 in where I live. I dont think the pastries' prices are not listed at all.. seemed like people from convention center just want to grab somethiglng real quick. but overall, not worth money.. my sandwich and OJ was total $26.

JvPtyvqmz5Of1VU2y78zmg.text: I was very pleased with this lemon cake. It was moist, yet not too heavy. It was not too sweet. It was "just right". I would get it again in a heartbeat. Probably the best dessert I've had in quite some time.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon cake

UR9pQY8bb6cadD4JKQo_eg.text: Our party had 2 lattes and 1 cappuccino followed by chocolate chip and lemon cookies. It was ALL exceptional and the two staff members working the desk were welcoming and lively. The coffee is the BEST I have had! We purchased a bag of the whole bean coffee and two matching cappuccino cups as a memento. If you are at or near Caesars Palace, you should treat yourself and make stop here. Excellent customer service and quality coffee :)

CL-_DcJK348TAOeE4qJ6kw.text: Muy delicioso! The gelato was yummy, as was the free lemon ricotta cookie. They gave my friend and me each 3 free cookies! Their 1 scoop of gelato was very large.

nAetu8IZS4X0hmVCWK5qQA.text: Quick good food! Of course its overly priced but what do you expect inside the casino. Excellent service though, even though its busy.

2sn9bbQ1ky7j_zIHVHMmXw.text: Bought a Groupon to take my friend to brunch here for her bday. On Groupon it lists "dark days" which means venue close April 20-21 and April 27-28. I bought it because I planned to take here May 4. After purchasing the Groupon it prompts to call and make reservations. The number is the direct number to Cesar's palace and then someone directs you to the restaurant. After a few rings it goes back to the directory. I am then told that they are closed for remodeling and won't reopen until May 4. At this point I am upset and decide well I'll just reschedule her bday brunch to Sunday May 5. Easy fix. But now the problem is how do I make a reservation? I decided to call today, may 4 when they are supposedly reopening according to their website and also the Cesar's directory person. Come to find out after they looked up more info that they will not be open until May 11! I can't get a hold of the restaurant and the information given isn't consistent. I am beyond upset because now I have spent $60 on a Groupon is can't even use for my friends bday which I have rescheduled twice. To top it off the coupon expires on May 31 but since they are closed this week I am limited to only one weekend to use it because you can't use it Mother's Day. It's really bs. Don't sell a Groupon if your establishment isn't even open!!!

Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Limited days to use the Groupon
Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their website staring closed April 20-May 4.

--0DJjVFYgmgoVSpXZMmqg.text: Okay for a quick bite but also not as impressive as I expected given the Giada brand.  I had a slice of margherita pizza that was fine but nothing  special.  It was also served lukewarm.  The lemon ricotta cookie, however, was utterly divine.  I was shocked, however, that they wouldn't give me a free cup of water with the purchase of a meal.  I don't think I've ever been asked to pay for tap water with a food purchase.  Edit: in response to the manager's comment, I was told that all tap water had a charge.  If that's not your policy, maybe a refresher training for the staff is in order.

dso_wouSiEC-NEEc3-cK1Q.text: Stayed at Caesars Palace 4 nights and this was our everyday go to breakfast and late night snack place!  Excellent breakfast sandwiches, tasty hash browns and unusually good oatmeal with olive oil and salt!  Great coffee and ricotta lemon cookies too.  Incredible to have a slim pretty woman create such yummy tasty food!

Qy5ZnU2lL1mSph8W6DmJFQ.text: Giada wouldn't be happy. BrianS wasn't happy.   A mixed bag...  Breakfast sandwiches got rave reviews.  All of them.   The Italian Rainbow cake looked a bit odd but I gave it a try. Sounded promising. But it was gummy. Didn't look like cake. Looked like Play Dough (tm) and tasted like it too. Phhht. A very poorly executed menu item.  Giada... I'm disappointed. And we're huge fans of yours. The glow is tarnished. Maybe less time on TV and a bit more in your restaurants would be a good thing?   Those free cookies had better be good.  Good news: the line moves quickly, efficiently, and the clerks are very nice.  But, gee whiz, I miss Payard.  PRO TIP: EATERS OF RAINBOW CAKE, DO NOT BE ALARMED THE NEXT DAY. WHAT ISN'T DIGESTIBLE PASSES, HOPEFULLY WITHOUT INDUCING COLON CANCER. IT IS VERY ALARMING BUT TRY NOT TO BE ALARMED!

Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6sXhRtWIGvZcd6JeE1sjUw.text: Everything looks amazing & tastes phenomenal. Staff is attentive & efficient. Place is clean. The hash browns are so delicious & the breakfast sandwiches are delicious. A bit on the pricey end, $6 for a cup of coffee, but I guess it was the experience, it was delicious though.

34z7eiesL5nMg7ZYrHrLnQ.text: Giada's place is very cute. I didn't order anything here at Pronto but ended up in her Wine bar that's adjacent to this. I orderd a glass of Sangria which I watched the Bartender make and it was very good.  This was the last stop on my Food Network Culinary journey through Vegas. It was great!!

5J0m0BC-Rkwzx4oo6IVUrw.text: Their chicken detox soup is absolutely delicious!  Additionally the lemon cookies were so incredible! Next time I am in Vegas I look forward to stoping by for some cookies and soup!

Al4xtQtabbbBHuLVu99h6A.text: It was okay. The quiches were cold even after we asked them to warm for a second time. However the lemon ricotta cookies are to die for.

UJwHPkRl8oFEQTe8i0qUcw.text: Love the pianni here. I ordered the turkey, avocado and bacon. It's kinda pricey but it's to be expected when purchasing food in a hotel. The muffin was really dry though. Service was quick and friendly.

9iWvQv7prpcOpshYWtYBJw.text: My colleague and I stopped here during a conference at Caesars. It seemed intriguing, and it definitely was convenient. Sadly, the best compliment I can give this place is that it's conveniently located next to Caesars' conference center.  None of the food was bad, but none of the food was particularly good either. And considering how expensive this "upscale cafeteria" is, and considering it now carries Giada's name, I expected better. The frittata tasted like the kind of egg dish I could find at just about any other 24 hour cafe on The Strip, and the orange juice tasted like a mid-range grocery store brand.  At least the coffee was good, but even that tasted close to what I could have found at a Coffee Bean or Peet's. I really wanted to like this place, I truly did. And while I don't hate it by any stretch, I'm just left lukewarm (kind of like my food there).

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Focaccia Margherita Pizza
Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sonoma Chardonnay

j3J3_fDXK2-q3b3OB6cf1g.text: It was moist and rich. It's a huge slice so make sure you have friends to help out, and tea to wash it down!

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nCD_fg4BgdRRhKeyFOhs1g.text: I am seriously hoping that Giada was just paid to use her name and isn't involved in any aspect of this restaurant. We got the pesto grilled cheese sandwich and the free lemon ricotta cookies . The cookies look amazing in the package but after one bite from two different people we ended up throwing them away. The lemon flavor doesn't taste like fresh lemon but an artificial flavoring. On to the sandwich . Surely you can't mess up grilled cheese right? Wrong! This sandwich had bland pesto and the same weird Leon taste.     This restaurant has ample seating and a cheerful atmosphere . We were there during a convention and I never saw but a few people sitting . I think it was a huge mistake to close Payard (which was always packed) for this restaurant.     I feel like I must say that I love the Giada restaurant at the Cromwell and can't believe that two restaurants owned by the same person are at such opposite ends of the food spectrum in regards to taste.

ZG1kte_9rwbybt0gpQckAQ.text: I liked the accessibility of the entire place and how it wasn't another sit-down service restaurant but a cheerful looking and casual place to grab something to eat. Whether it's a healthy salad or a scoop of gelato, it's a great place to take a break. The staff is very friendly and let us sample all of the gelato before settling on a favorite. The store has some cute items as well for Giada fans and the home chef.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Espresso Macchiato gelato

NqT6DHSd_uQ2vHOhpN8V1g.text: If your a huge breakfast sandwich fan like I am then Pronto is the place to go!  I love!!!!!!! The Antipasti breakfast sandwich. Layers of goodness and flavor!  Do yourself a huge favor and come check out the breakfast sandwiches at Pronto you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Morning and lunch offerings!

DQHEioK21Z9PEIhQEmTiZQ.text: We stopped by for breakfast and left disappointed. We both got the antipasta sandwich and two coffees, $35. We wouldn't have minded the price had the quality been better. The sandwich was very bland and a breakfast sandwich from McDonalds would have been more tasteful and appealing. It's a convenient stop and very cute, but I don't think I'll order there again. A small coffee was $5...I'd rather go to Starbucks (go to Starbucks and order a venti iced cinnamon macchiato with coconut milk mmmmmm or go to a 7 Eleven for just as good of a coffee).   Pronto: please add salsa or hot sauce to your condiment section. Your sammies need a little extra flavor. Maybe some Taco Bell fire sauce?

EqrQdLe_21y_Ba5J_4TiAg.text: I love you Giada, but this was such a bad experience I thought you need to know how poorly your restaurant is being run. Made reservation for brunch at 11:15 AM. Didn't get seated till 11:45. Had to wait while your maitre 'd had to clean the table by herself!! I watched while your servers were "washing and drying the dishes and glasses by hand. Seems pretty unsanitary to me after they have been picking up dirty dishes off tables   Surely you can afford a dishwasher! Service was sooooo slow. Hated that we sat so close to other patrons. Also, did not like that the restaurant was so open. All the people walking through the casino we're going by the food areas smoking, coughing and breathing on the buffet items. Ugh, all I thought of was germs spreading on my food. Not appetizing at all. The lady making omelettes also  was the carver. Really spread thin and frazzled. I was seated on the bench side of the table and almost needed a booster seat, because the table was so high. Did not like the fact that the breads were sitting out and dried out. Overpriced for the selections. I'm so disappointed, Giada. I think this about covers it!! Truly a BIG disappointment and we can't recommend your restaurant to anyone. The worst part of this is that our daughter purchased this for my husband as a Father's Day gift through Travelzoo. She was so excited because we all love watching your shows. I was sad to tell her it was not worth the money she works hard for  I hope you can make some necessary changes. We won't be back. PS the signs by the food were written so small that I had no idea what they were!! Additionally, some of the items had NO signage. You can do better than this!!!

2I6NgpFSjXSjil-LE6cDRg.text: There is really nothing Pronto about this place. Sure, they have a bunch of grab-and-go items but their staff is extremely slow. Plus, horrible customer service! I got myself the chocolate chip cookies (which taste ok - really can't mess up cookies) and a cappuccino. Mind you, the cappuccino is $6 for a VERY small cup. I've been to Italy so I know that it's not supposed to be in a big cup anyways but it was atrocious! It tasted horrible!! Literally tasted like dirt and water. I normally don't send things back but I stood back in line as the cashiers slowly rang other customers up. I told her that the cappuccino was not what I expected so I replaced it with a Latte instead. The cashier gave me attitude and reluctantly made me a latte (which by the way, was not any better). Their attitude is more bitter than their coffee! Next time, I'll go to Starbucks, thanks!

C7wdolKfwQJZpJpJ75dsUg.text: Good restaurant food is amazing and authentic Italian. We loved the pasta very fresh and came in a cheese wheel yum

cE3QhCY4eA1_Zpi6R1C_Wg.text: Giada opened up a 2nd location in Vegas. She already has Giada at The Cromwell which is great. Pronto is unique. You have an assortment of breakfast and lunch items, coffees and desserts all in a spot that is comfortable but also in the middle of the action. It's really a special place on the strip. The lemon ricotta cookies are simply amazing. The coffee is great. Can't say enough great things about Giada and her new Vegas spot!

WdSPzBSZRRcb3ZeWtm4gTg.text: Nice options if you don't want to eat at the Food Court in Caesars. Expect to pay  at least $15 for a one person meal (Panini and Side). The lemon cookies are TO DIE FOR.

oppDwfo6YZqDRmJtaT9jtw.text: My fiance and i walked by Pronto by Giada one morning and decided to give it a try. The service was good, nothing too special about it.   We ordered one latte and one americano. They only have one size available for the americano and it's small. We also ordered one of their breakfast sandwich AntiPasti. We weren't very hungry so we both had the same sandwich. It was good we both liked it.   Also because i checked-in, we had the lemon ricotta cookies and i loved them.   Overall, it's a good place to try if you are staying at Ceasars Palace.

2ub391E9xEEm_w5YM2hi0w.text: We loved pronto in vegas. Small and quick run thru and they give u free cookiesnif u check in

-VdZHTWY4BW0uMFggiGDEw.text: Best latte in Caesars...had to find something other than Starsucks.   Found this spot and now it's my go to!  Staff is always pleasant, fast and the food looks great - cucumber juice hit the spot!   Haven't tried the wine bar but will be back to check it out!

td1H_T_gFg1aUPVMSvzziA.text: Staying at Caesar's, so we stopped here to grab a quick breakfast - both breakfast sandwiches were delicious. Don't forget to check in on Yelp - you get a free package (of 3) lemon ricotta cookies!

-KsrhuE3PSQi9SpmlMw00Q.text: The vegetable frittata was a perfect breakfast for my first morning in Vegas! It was fresh and full of flavor. The breakfast sandwich was good too. It a great quick breakfast option.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast menu

Sh03u6zhAtw3qZ9i2zPHiw.text: I tried the lemon cookies and sin city chocolate chip cookies which were absolutely incredible. I can't wait to come back to try the gelato and muffaletta!

uOCUdvmEx2_ezbTiwzyx8w.text: Great coffee and treats! Wine bar is awesome too! Use the Yelp check in and try the lemon ricotta cookies- they're a perfect match to a cappuccino...

NSgFBboqBStqg3ZicPPorw.text: Food looked fresh and healthy. Premade arugula salad with prosciutto started off tasting odd, but as you continued, the flavors blended and complimented each other wonderfully. The cannoli was ok. The raspberry bar was good. Our biggest disappointment was the two Mango-lime smoothies we ordered :( Too much lime in the mixture which made it overly bitter.  I did appreciate the manager's willingness to fix the situation with the smoothie when I went back. Very professional and apologetic.

CPNUnBI6ZfunanRFn-9pgA.text: Made a reservation online weeks prior, arrived at 10AM Saturday morning to celebrate an early Mother's Day with my son for the weekend Brunch, loved it!  The quick snack area was busy with a long line, but the area for the brunch was thankfully much less busy and we were seated immediately upon arrival. Very upscale place with pleasant staff.  Our server was very friendly, but took a long time to bring us drinks, think she had way too many tables, but she always kept a smile on her face.  The food was delicious, not an extensive selection as at other buffets, but the foods offered were very high quality.  Our server came by only twice, to take our drink order and to bring it, didn't come to offer refills (we would have liked water or different drinks) and we had to go to the bar to ask her for our bill.  Will definitely come back, because the food and the ambiance were amazing, but mgmt needs to hire more staff to service guests.

jjzrzLGsUE5Dq0hUhfK-Jw.text: Amazing food and cocktails. Brenda is fantastic!! The hot paninis and tiramisu melts in your mouth.

pXuzrKlIcuN0wag5LFil8A.text: DELICIOUS!!!! And top notch customer service don't miss this place at Cesar's Palace!

aJly2yMSvv3wl8bC5egD8Q.text: So yummy then I read the ingredients.  Why did you spoil it for me. .but if you dont care, the teast is amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great stuff

aztnPI5WpJSRaUlsBBDAvw.text: It was so bad experience  the food is burned because the worker are talking with each other  the pancetta  sandwich is burned and it was so hard I ask a refund amounting 17.30 but instead of refunded my money they charge me again additional 6.05  Charge again on my card .  They don't know what they're doing. And arguing that they put attention. On it then why the sand which is burned and so hard.   Please do some actions with this because it was so bad experience   .  I talked to the manager and she said I'm not charge on my card double but I talk to my bank and they say I have other charge with the same merchant Pronto Giada  Why they are lieng. And did this . They don't know what they're doing.  Please Dont argue with the customers  because you know that your fault. Never apologize their arguing on me and  said he put attention on it then why my sandwich order is burned?  Employee or guest or any person must be treated nicely  because at the end of the day we still a customer.

2Xk5GPC2SxHnGG11jqRRkQ.text: Let me first state that I am not terribly price sensitive.  If it is really high quality and the price is higher than I would normally expect, I don't hesitate to pay for quality.  The problem here is that while the quality is above average, it is not off the charts and the price is crazy high.  $16.95 for what is essentially half a sandwich at any normal restaurant is just too much.  Also, we got our food to go and the soup lid was only half on, resulting in a bag with about 1/4 of the soup in it.  Thus, while food was reasonably good, I cannot in any way recommend this from a value context.

_SAeN4r3Ano-Kcrm9tdC0A.text: 9 dollars for a large coffee to go.  Really.  Coffee.  And it wasn't that great.  The brunch was nice but not really worth the $45 dollars and the $15 dollars up charge for the mimosa.   Maybe 45 with everything include.  Go across the hall and get the Caesar buffet for $50.  At least they have a larger option other then deli meats and an omelet..

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uGpHKgqlPnTLqbl3vDeXhA.text: A little disappointed by the quality of the food. We sat down about 30 minutes till the breakfast/brunch ended. The pork loin, chicken was very dry. There was no juice to add for it. The omelet was decent. The fruit and yogurt was great. The coffee too! The waitress was amazing but the others in the food area could use some smiles in their life. They just looked so grumpy. My other half did not enjoy the food at all or the setting. Thankfully the waitress was sweet enough to offer to take his stuff off the bill since he only had water. I wish I caught her name- she truly made my day with her sweetness and smile.

k0dHXhwfKj5ZDA8B6jGCLg.text: Got the turkey sandwich which was yummy but eh on the price of it.   Also got the free lemon cookies that you get when you check in on yelp which were definitely lemon-y lol. The cookie reminded me of those super sugary soft cookies you get from grocery stores that have icing and sprinkles on them.   The last thing I got was their sorbet/Ice cream. I forgot the flavors but the ice cream is what you should get for dessert when you go.

ya4m_-07F1byger2HStgXQ.text: Awesome!!!!  Great lemon cookies I was here .on vacation and was totally amazed at the variety of foods as well .  I will definitely come back next time I am in Vegas...

hrDiO5p5_ee6Tm_mTjbn7w.text: I'm a huge fan of Giada but not Pronto. So disappointed over brunch today. Reservations for 11 we were seated at 11:45. The hostess told us that we just needed to be patient.  Food was all cold except for the made to order omelettes. We were eating it before we even had our drink order in.  One server tending to tables, no manager present. Chef at carving station continued to leave the station causing the chef making the omelettes to pop over and carve meat. Many guests were very upset.  Food was mediocre. waitress came up and served us our drinks apologizing for the wait. The only plus were the lemon ricotta cookies!  Sorry this is not recommended:(

5s9x0s6AmGLoWfDiME4FSw.text: The worst service in Las Vegas, reservations at 11 and seated at 1150. Food ice cold! Hostess rude and omelet chef over worked! (Omelet was the only good  and warm food ).  Understaffed !! WILL NEVER COME BACK!!!

9tjTasA_if5Not1hCdnOCw.text: The decoration of this grab and go place is nice. Clean and inviting and bright colors. It's set up in one long line. They sell a bunch of stuff, from ice cream to sandwiches.  They do run out of items, so go earlier in the day.  We got a slice of the chocolate cake and the rainbow cake in the colors of the Italian flag. Giada herself is Italian. We also got the lemon ricotta cookies. They come three in a bag.  The chocolate cake was dry and not too much flavor. The cookies were much too sweet. And I love sweet stuff! The rainbow cake was the best. So light and airy and tasted like almond cake. Just amazing. I would return just for that cake!

Ev-uaSgWig8Yi9VQI3vxsQ.text: The food is spot on, and if you get the bottomless mimosas you actually have options between different champagnes! But I have to say the best part of the experience is seeing how well the staff keeps their composure through the busiest times. Shout out to Stephanie the hostess and Antonia our server, so fantastic!

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Napkins!

J_QI_YqDPx2TBf3pNIRuOg.text: We stayed at Ceasar's and walked by Giada's probably 25 times before we stopped in. Man, do I wish we'd stopped by earlier. We had the breakfast buffet, which was small but very delicious. The service was the best we received anywhere in Vegas (including the crazy expensive places).  The best part?  The coffee!  They brought unlimited delicious coffees from the attached coffee bar. Mmmmm...

HG4rLr0Gk6-ary8RH2fk9Q.text: The lemon cookies...oh the lemon cookies. Muffuletta is great along with the sausage soup.

o1VzucuOrxpNw6LFvJxPVg.text: ...back again, Pronto does not dissapont. We had Antonia as our server again and she is AMAZING! I forgot about the watermelon and cucumber juice; but thats ok because the Bellinis and Cappuccinos were delicious! The Italian Rainbow cake was my favorite, it was so much better than the Mascarpone cheesecake if thats even possible. I highly reccomend the hazelnut pastry and the chocolate chip cookies.  Thank you for a great experience, i look forward to my next visit

f0j3Dar-saCZ3tseNirInA.text: I love Giada on TV so I had to try this place. Everything looked so good I didn't know what to order. I was staying at the Cesar's so I ate from here a few times. The first time I had a salad with grilled chicken. The chicken was tasteful and soft. By checking in on yelp you get a free lemon pastry and that was great with my coffee.   I also had the soup of the day, it had a good flavor and was satisfying. That same day I made a stop at night time for some coconut gelato. That was my favorite thing from this place oh and the yogurt parfait, it was perfect.

0idZFJo06PbpTfl89HOWOw.text: Great refreshing and healthier brunch! Super friendly staff, Shanneka was our server and our bottomless champagne were never empty! Food was very fresh and tasty, leaving you fully satisfied but not stuffed to the point where you feel blah.....

W3QvX0N0zttHRn1UN4k7-A.text: What a lifesaver Pronto was! My boyfriend and I flew to Vegas from LA and arrived to Caesars pretty late on a Friday night about a month ago. We were both starving, and nothing in the hotel except Pronto was open. We each ordered a panini (which ones, I can't recall) and were pretty satisfied. They were pretty large portions, so we definitely could have just split one. What I remember most vividly, however, is how delicious the hash browns were when we stopped for a quick breakfast the next morning. I could have eaten them all day--they were crispy and so full of flavor! I also appreciated that my favorite candy just happened to be at the cash register (raspberry and blackberry gummies). Overall, this is a great little place to hit before you head out on The Strip!

x7aA1Gd7gHYEHtwK2JlLZQ.text: Greasy expensive yet cheap food. This is really a horrible place and should not be in Caesar's. Really brings down the place. I hope it closes.

bb8Al8rP3fPeTJDb2qlFWg.text: Enjoyed the frittata and fruit cup, very reasonable!

9zbwZUhl43QO301VYme30w.text: Such a nice little stop for a quick bite to eat lunch! I loved my chicken salad and it's an adorable atmosphere!

NPerzhp8HeBGy-vyiVTySA.text: I am a big fan of Giada's show on TV and was really excited to try her restaurants in LV. I first went to Pronto inside Caesar's palace after some searching inside the casino as I kept losing my way around the huge casino. I ordered the panchetta sandwich and a cappuccino. You first stand in line with one register where you order food. Then you go to a second set of registers where you pay. Not sure I understand this system where you order at one register and pay at a secondary of registers. The food was good, but not exceptional. May be I had higher expectations before going in.

W4KsGg9jDsI9uO6jPzSVzg.text: Pronto it was and absolutely delicious. Nice to see reasonable prices from what seems to be a marquis chef in the culinary world and on the strip. Great selection of both sweet and savory, staff was friendly as well

TnBU9cmNq9eBGBz0mpU0Wg.text: Greatest lemon ricotta cookies!!! Excellent choices of quality food. Wonderful staff.

ZpBD4VahSE-pTaN-VT1PVw.text: It's nothing special. Food offerings are basic and flavors are not elevated. Service was decent in terms of timing and attitude. It's fine if your expectations are appropriately set.

H2IHUzp5-pfL4vMY7B21Cw.text: I love Giada and her restaurant in the Cromwell but for what they are serving at Pronto the prices are high. A small tea $5 is ridiculous. Likewise the rest of the items are mediocre and overpriced. The market area is cute /souvenirs

ZV1ht8nSNx2H7sXk_mkrUw.text: I have found pronto to be a nice break from burgers and sit down meals. It's quick good, not fast food. I've enjoyed the sandwiches and love the grilled salmon. The coffee is very good. As far as prices go it's on par with prices on the strip these days. Really makes for a nice quick option for good food as you walk around. Don't expect white glove 5 star service it's not meant to be that kind place.

zLlLx8CXNYPfEoxQFCDaiA.text: Food is ok, nothing to write home about. Coffee tasted like every other coffee I've ordered from a Starbucks but cost more. Not worth a trip to eat there.

NNn_7lQBxljPjmvlJ53Slw.text: Citrus Mistress with a side of Marcona almonds at the wine bar is an A+! On my way out, I grabbed a latte with almond milk (thank you for the non-dairy option) and a white bean, tuna with arugula salad - perfect amount of lemon. Overall I was very impressed by the wait time and bar service. Perfect stop and go option for this area of the strip.

krHXHYcpTbhSQp5M_BO7EA.text: Little bit pricey but great options. The marinated olives were so yummy. Black and white cookies were disappointing. I was expecting a vanilla cake type cookie but it was lemon covered in white and dark chocolate. Still good but not what was expected. Needs better drink options. Also had the mixed fruit cup with dipping honey. Again with lemon in the honey.

PrI9an2r3ZCKm94zYVIiIA.text: Recently stopped by to check out the wine. The bartender Brenda was AMAZING! She was very knowledgeable and friendly. The best service I have received. She had a thorough knowledge of the selection and gave excellent recommendations. Will definitely be stopping by again to visit her and the great selection offered. Any wine enthusiasts definitely stop by and have a glass with Brenda.

0nQlG4RLraS9jWeUVJNtTQ.text: You basically get the same quality as the restaurant across the street for about half of the price. It's only about 10% of the menu but the food is amazing quality. Highly recommended for a lunch spot on The Strip.

qw4kDp1jjvVpjlH-VfXw-w.text: Had a caprese panini and a Diet Pepsi. I realize I'm in Caesars but was a little caught off guard by the price. Minus the price of the Diet Pepsi my experience was pleasant. The panini was excellent and this was a quick option as we had just checked in after an early morning flight.

9tIueJf71jG5ImkESHAr5g.text: I love that a fast casual restaurant is so perfectly located by the entrance to the convention space at Caesars Palace.  I visited this outlet three or four times over a week long conference and really enjoyed the Counter Culture coffee and lemon cookies.  After a long day of meetings, nothing is better than fresh coffee and a little sugar!  Unfortunately, I had dinners scheduled during my trip, but will be back to try their impressive wines by the glass list. Thanks Giada!

5x1WPK6pLXVne_tQzZsoVQ.text: Awesome food. Great grab & go. Loved the Sunday brunch. The staff is super nice & helpful.

P21bNQrMVuXMFOhO9r4mwA.text: Starbucks is one million times better for half the price. My $10 breakfast sandwich was over-microwaved which left it rubbery and gross. Potatoes had no flavor or seasoning, actually that's pretty much all the food. The parfait was good but how can you mess that up. And coffee, meh. Just way overpriced and overrated. Won't go back.

080i17pdg8QIhJf4oKU9sQ.text: This is more of a grab n go, fast food service deli at Ceasars Palace owned by one of my fave celebrity chefs, Giada DeLaurentis. So I had to check this place out!! My friend and I arrived at a busy time with a crazy hacker convention going on at one of the hotel's meeting rooms. So the crowd made for a busy crowded rushed experience. I didn't like being crowded, but the food here looks delicious! There's pizza, pasta, salads, sandwiches/paninis, custom order small meal plate w/chicken, fish, or veggie. There's also a coffee/espresso bar, gelato, and shave ice menu. I ordered a small hot plate w/roasted broccolini, and cheesy potatoes. It was delicious! I also grabbed a bag of plain kettle chips, and a bottle of acqua panna water. I also made room for dessert. The staff was kind enough to let me sit down and finish my meal, then order my gelato afterwards. All I had to do was show my receipt of purchase and pick out my gelato flavors. I got the nutella stracciatella & pistachio flavored gelatos!! The flavors did not disappoint!! I recommend them both! I would return again. And I definitely recommend going here. The food was fresh, tasty, and healthy sized portions. The main thing that bummed me out was that they didn't have the lobster roll sandwich available! I really wanted to visit here for the lobster roll & gelato. Oh well next time. I'll be back Pronto!!

ZOwG-8y-AWHgvxSE0O9OMQ.text: Love  pronto by Giada the food never disappoints. Every time we go to Vegas we have to visit this spot not to mention the atmosphere is super chill and makes u want to buy everything. I also love that I can purchase some kitchen pieces at this location. I just wish they had one in California!

kfFYiEItF6S09paR1j2pfA.text: Visited on multiple occasions during my hotel stay. Nice bistro setting, bright and airy being in contrast with the casino floor nearby. Espresso strong with good crema. Ricotta Cookies were nice and light however way too sweet for my liking (lemon icing). Recommend trying chocolate cookies, those were decadent! Broth soup for lunch was delicious.

lZ82MWVamDm5nP69twhEqA.text: I love this spot! Quick friendly service for a quick yummy bit to eat and caffeine pick me up. The muffuletta is my absolute favorite, highly recommend trying!

Elv5nArOk2qP5AHmbiH-zQ.text: I went to Pronto for a quick look-see and was surprised to find fresh watermelon, orange and cucumber juice selections.  All the sandwiches and salads and other offerings look amazing.  Next time I go, when I have more time, I plan on getting either the salmon or steak.  The seating area has somehow managed to be a calm and quiet escape from the noise of the casino bustle.  I cancelled out my healthy selection of cucumber juice with an order of the lemon cookies... which were a hit with me and my colleagues.  And one further commendation was the number of Caesar's employees who were standing in line with me!

kZjnEJm4ehAnVu_FGjzg4w.text: Huge Giada fan right here!!!  First stop on my birthday weekend and guess what?!  A Giada sighting as I was there buying a ton of her merchandise!!!  Lucky me!  Pronto is located at the Caesars Hotel.  Came to check out the famous lemon ricotta cookies and coffee.  Which by the way you can check in on Yelp and get you the ricotta cookies for free!  The cookies were moist so moist and went well with the beautiful cup of coffee.    Staff was friendly and courteous.  Especially the lady that helped me at the gift shop.  She saw I was buying a lot of paraphernalia and was kind enough to bubble wrap my breakables for the plane ride home.      Didn't get to buy the whole store so I will be back...until next time Pronto!  Hahahahaha!

AK19xRX7QP_n-8kOcGJ0ug.text: While visiting Las Vegas I always have a tough time deciding where I want to eat because my inner foodie is pulled in multiple directions.  Giada is one of my favorite Food Network stars so when I found out they offer a brunch on the weekends I knew I had to give it a whirl.    So much to say but the first word that comes to mind is AMAZING!!!  Bottomless mimosas,cappuccino,lattes, juices and much more.  Then you add the food there is no going wrong here at all, the staff is super nice ( a little slow on the drinks but really not an issue)   After you finish you can do a little shopping, she has so many cute thing that I couldn't resist picking up a few things before I left!  Must try the kale omelet, lemon ricotta cookies, and of course all the pastas she had..  We will be back!!!

Jb_KtxdOvC9jxRNYHN7ijg.text: This was a one star at best. The place was really messy, the staff was basically nonexistent, you couldn't tell where the line began or ended. Everyone was just bunched around the register. My brother in law got a cannoli that was gummy and old. The staff wouldn't refund his money, just offered cookies that were $5.00 less. The whole place was a cluster.

Wyc0nSz2VBXjeT8UuUqdgw.text: it can be pricey depending on what you order, but i got their "Giada's oatmeal" made with extra virgin olive oil, maldon salt, mandarin oranges, and almonds. i was a little skeptical because i'm not used to this combination in oatmeal but O-M-G... the combination couldn't have been more perfect. a simple, tasty, sweet and savory on-the-go breakfast.. i wish i'd have gotten it earlier on my trip, i would've definitely been back!   also, don't forget to check-in and take advantage of the free lemon ricotta glazed cookies. they're amazing, too!  happy eating!

sklqIZ0ikJ1Os07u8x0BAg.text: The $8 nitro cold brew was in the top 3 worst cups of coffee I've ever had. Not sure if the beans are trash or that's the Vegas tap water talking, but it was nasty either way.

sO4cvjyQhzYUedgdyN6WYg.text: I am a huge fan of Giada. Sadly, not of the service here at Pronto.   Three things.. 1. I asked politely if I could order from the tables in Wine bar area. Female bartender reply "I don't do table service".. flatly I might add. Hmmm... okay, strike one.  2. Female bartender gave me a taste of wine which was opposite of what I told her I like. Then I asked "what about this one? May I try it?" Female bartender reply "No" flatly again. Nothing else, just "No"  3. I ordered Goat Cheese Stuffed Peppers & Grilled Long Stemmed Artichokes. Female bartender reply "We are out"... as I'm going to open my mouth to say my next options, Female bartender says "Let me tell you what we do have". List was short.. maybe 7 items out of 14 (so half of the menu was NOT available).   UPDATE... I'm writing this as I sit here. My muffuletta is taking a while so Female bartender comes over and brings a choice of 3 bags of chips... apologizes it's taking so long and offered one of the 3 bags to me. That was nice of her.. so 1/2 a star more.    My muffuletta is now here... going to enjoy this I hope!

7OmLrNgCfdBcOiIaBf8e_g.text: Cute little breakfast and brunch place if you want something light. There is also a brunch buffet by the wine bar which $29 a person where you can omelets, salad, pastries. It's a bit on the pricey end but if you want to enjoy a light breakfast this is the place to be
