kcXLzqYAJzP8p2A3s-cJvg.text: Came here on Christmas Eve. There's a great view of all the people waiting in line for Bacchanal (Caesar's palace renovated buffet). Lemon cookies were really good. Maybe the one of the best I have ever had. Also got a almost 10 latte. Worth it? Well let's just say it's a must try. I am a bargain guy, so spending double on something needs to really be justified in my book.   Nice place to chill and enjoy being around the crowd, yet can have a conversation with someone if you choose to.   Wifey suggested this place, so we had to come check it out.

_fCZYHra1fSNFXEXPddlQA.text: This is perfect for lunch or breakfast! Great selection and delicious food! Efficient and quick enough for large crowds. The frittata is amazing!

JE8utNlndtULxMuL5juVaQ.text: The staff was friendly and inviting to me and the area was very clean.  CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIE If you like cookie dough and dark chocolate without being overly sweet you may just have found what you are looking for. While it is not to my personal taste the use of bread flour adds a doughy flavor and texture thus making the cookie more of a soft baked cookie. The  dark chocolate flavor bitterness and richness comes through without a contrasting sweetness which may be liked by those looking for that in their flavor profile. If you are not into cookie dough or would like a bit more sweetness to mellow out or contrast the sharp flavor of the chocolate this one may not be for you.   LEMON RICOTTA WITH LEMON GLAZE COOKIES. This cookie is on the more sweeter side and could go well with a nice tea with milk. The sweetness mainly comes from the glaze which also has a lemon flavor accenting it. The soft cookie may have some lemon rind in it however the sweet and lemony glaze overwhelms the cookie altogether. By itself the cookie lacks balance between the cookie and the glaze. This can be overly sweet for some thus the recommendation of a warm drink should help round out the sweetness. Perhaps even the selection of a gelato to make your personal mini ice cream sandwich would be something to try.  OVERALL  It was a pleasant to taste the treats and meet the kind staff at this location. The atmosphere and location gives you a chance to talk and people watch.   For both cookies a warm mocha or tea may help contribute the flavors and  enhance the dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Getting cookies!

Vg1hy7Imn1Ce068Ic8K4Bw.text: It's okay. The Nutella Latte my wife got was delicious for sure, but the three dishes I tasted were all a little bland to me. Maybe it's just my lack of a sophisticated palette but I just didn't enjoy any of the foods I tried here.   I got a watermelon juice which was nice. Five bucks. But nice.   I think the Nutella Latte is definitely a must try for people who like coffee and have a bit of a sweet tooth, but other than that I don't think this is a place I'd be upset about skipping next time I'm in town.

Tb5FMkKDGJSxiOm29fVTDQ.text: Was craving something sweet while walking around Caesar's and stumbled upon Pronto. I like Giada's show and knew it would be good. While I was in line I noticed that if I checked in on Yelp, that I would get a lemon ricotta cookies. The 3 cookies were so soft and I enjoyed the icing on them. Definitely check in if you are nearby. Their pasta salads looked amazing.  I got the chocolate olive oil gelato. It was a nice cold treat to enjoy on such a hot day. The olive oil kept the gelato from being too sweet. Pronto is definitely the spot if you are looking for something sweet or a quick light meal.

6P63a28LJzi3UT_6VKpisw.text: This is a great spot for a quick, fast casual bite in Las Vegas. A little tough to find in the maze that is Caesar's Palace. It has a bar area that is a little classier, and a cafeteria style casual area that has sandwiches, pasta salads, gelato, and other items for purchase. We got a panini, two sides and gelato for what we thought was reasonable Vegas pricing (under $30). All the food was high quality, especially the gelato flavors. Great for families and vegetarians.

m9SyqiFK_mXpNGJiFBdTmg.text: Way too expensive. Paid $10 for a cup of fresh fruit! The chocolate croissant was very good but overall the food is too expensive.

IXX_Gfr-YuCAb5k5tno2dA.text: Went here a frew times. The coffee and cookies were my favorites.  I would recommend for a light breakfast or lunch. Really quick too.

y75maSu2oN6k7VW414HGfw.text: Pronto by Giada was a disappointment.  The food was great but the service was appalling.  Each time we needed beverage refills we had to ask several servers before this happened.  Dirty dishes were allowed to stack up on our table.  On the buffet, items were consistently empty and the staff was slow to refill them. The same thing happened with the plates. When I'm paying $45 per person plus beverages and tip, I expect exceptional service. When we talked to the manager about our experience, he said, "The restaurant just opened and we're working out the bugs."  When I'm at a Caesars Palace high end restaurant, I expect an exceptional experience. I don't want to be a guinea pig unless they are comping the meal.

3XmCAPseNt2Z7JlDlvqRgQ.text: I was really excited about trying Pronto but was extremely disappointed.  PROS: -Good location in Caesars Palace -Breakfast and light snack options (something Vegas is certainly lacking in) -The women behind the counter were friendly and accommodating   CONS: -Overpriced, crowded, the tables were not clean when I was there -The oatmeal was so salty I couldn't eat it, by the time I sat down to eat, the line was so long that I just threw it out instead of trying to return it. -Chocolate croissant (which they warmed, appreciate that) was so melted and sopping wet that it tasted more like a hersheys bar melted onto a piece of limp bread.  Hoping management can figure out how to get this potentially great place up to GIADA standards.

bSopMsBGuVd-Y5111_UTXg.text: This is probably the best to go place at Caesars and good too boot. Highly recommend their gelato s and cookies.

bZHBFNo4UEvCQ9GPPqNVvA.text: Delicious food! Very nice staff very friendly:)I will recommend it to everyone! Very good for people who eat healthy.

H0JKKZKU2LBEZ4jB1tIZ0w.text: Awesome place anytime of day! Best meal ever! Will always get the turkey sandwich there.

0YD32ogwn57o1vGbk_Pypg.text: The best coffee and pastries!! The lemon ricotta cookies are out of this world!  Lunch was salmon with broccolini and grilled veggies!  Great!

Fe1J4hG55cp9qPcDona1yQ.text: Terrible. Over priced dry banana bread. Bad set up, they don't even give you a tray for your food. Never again.

qZ3ZF85oJ37bYuzI5G05fQ.text: Visiting Las Vegas for a conference and wanted to grab a quick bite to it. Stumbled upon this place and I was glad I did. I got the turkey bacon avocado sandwich. Oh my gosh it was so good. Served warm with the special sauce, I loved it. Their cookies are really good as well. The food is really good but really pricey. $15 for a sandwich is a little crazy.

PJ6hBdbBotB8mOIRkcUoPQ.text: Great spot! Stopped by after cleaning up at the craps tables and wow, food was fresh and delicious. I am an excellent gambler with a discerning palate and I was impressed. Definitely worth stopping by

UMyPaZesqVVMvDpuc8ty5g.text: Total disappointment especially since it was pricey.  I do understand you need to charge extra since you are in a casino, but $5 for a San Pellegrino is a bit too much.  Also the muffaletta sandwich for $15 was too expensive since it was very small in size.  There was not much in the sandwich itself for that price.  Nothing special. We also had the meatball soup and it was flavorless and the meatballs were kind of rubbery tasting. Couldn't even finish it.

RJL534qFJ283z3XJ3ocU1A.text: While I was sorry that Payard was shuttered I think that Giada's Pronto may be a worthy replacement.  My wife and I decided to have a quick dinner in the room while watching the VGKs' play the Capitals in the opening game of the Stanley Cup playoffs.  Pronto it was as we were able to walk down from the Augustus Tower at Caesars, order, get our meals and be back in the room without missing any of the game during the break between the 2nd and 3rd period.    Wife had the frittata and I had the mixed grill with steak, grilled vegetables and caprese.  We were both pleasantly surprised with the quality and generous portions.  My sliced flank steak was quite flavorful and the mixed veggies (asparagus, onion, red and yellow peppers portabella mushroom exceeded my expectations.  Might have just been my lucky day but the cherry tomato halves in the caprese may have been the sweetest I have had in many years.  The steak had great flavor and was relatively tender and given that it was reheated wasn't much past medium rare.  Contrary to other reviews we found the counter staff to be exceptionally pleasant and efficient.  We've eaten several times at Giada's at the Cromwell and actually feel that Pronto offers a better value.  Granted, you are eating out of a plastic to-go container with plastic cutlery but put my order on a white plate and have it served to me and I would be glad to pay more than double the $16 it cost at Pronto.  We'll definitely be back to try some of their other offerings.  Recommended!

5u9X7Czf47xygB7_SUgboQ.text: Super unimpressed, food was mediocre at best and service was lacking... they weren't busy so I don't understand why it was like this. Wouldn't spend a penny here again.

KMt8_SLFBpM3DfoRQXmuuQ.text: Love Giada but does not represent her well. Good food, ridiculously expensive prices, and mediocre staff.

2JFQL1ArV7HPNGdEmjXo3A.text: Giada, Giada, Giada!  This is not you. Some imposter opened a place called Pronto and put your name on it.  It is disappointing. Tables were dirty. Got half way through the salad and knew something was off. No dressing. Went back and was told the cashier knows to hand that out at purchase. It's 1:00 pm, really wouldn't mind having a glass of wine with lunch. Oh, but the wine bar is not open. Asked several employees and none seem to know when it opens. 11:00, 3:00, not sure, haven't seen the bartender, we were told. Sorry, won't come back.

7m6ROhlGu3JmASI8x5EptQ.text: Visited Pronto by Giada during a conference to grab a quick bite in between sessions. Ordered a cappuccino and Plie au Choc (Chocolate Croissant). Cappuccino was well made with just the right amount of foam and Chocolate Croissant was flaky and not too sweet. Great place to stop into and grab coffee/pastries. Service was superb - cashier made small talk and asked where I was from. Very sociable and experience was welcoming.

_oeYQl--MhoHzAd-SEii7g.text: I get it!!!  It's my fault your staff doesn't understand english.  I ordered a vanilla latte.  At no time did your staff speak in english you didn't offer a vanilla latte.

rmcuXdM2xKSj6VPr-_CgHA.text: The wine list is wonderful! There are several wines available at every price point, with each of them being offered in 3-, 5-, and 9-ounce pours. I enjoyed two 5-ounce pours of the Rochioli Sauvignon Blanc and the Prunotto Costamiole Barbera. They were both so good that I saved their names in my phone to remember for later. While there, I also enjoyed some marcona almonds, a charcuterie board, and Giada's famous lemon ricotta cookies, which are an absolute must! I can't wait to introduce this place to my other wine-loving friends!

X_fud9IZuKrELWcn2vgq3Q.text: My friend and I stopped by for a bit of a happy hour the other night and I was so impressed with the vast wine selection by the glass! The staff was friendly and the space was very nice. Also you have to try the lemon ricotta cookies, such an explosion of flavor.

gcArOAGHDdKXU66_rEDXuw.text: I grew up watching Giada on TV and couldn't wait to try Pronto! I had the Ham Gruyere and Apple Panini, and it was DELICIOUS. Didn't get a chance to try any of the desserts but they all looked so fresh and amazing.

OATI5vKzYcAh7BLHm6IcVA.text: Little hidden gem in at Caesars Palace. Had a negroni to wash down my lobster roll. Will definitely be back when I'm Vegas!

CiGtf3apm6OiMITkGcBYDw.text: Not only was the food delicious and the service quick and easy, but the entire ambiance of the restaurants embodies Giada's atheistic. My standards for a classic latte are pretty high, but the one I ordered met my expectations. My family enjoyed the deserts and snacks. This is definitely for the traveler on the go, needing a quick bite that trumps the other options in Cesar's and on the strip!!!! Bravo!

jc_gz6NGoIcmr32A9z4w3g.text: I've been here a couple of times. The staff are always friendly and very courteous. Lemon ricotta and cheese cake are so delicious. Muffuletta is Amazing. You can really taste the quality of the ingredients.

4ziXh-rH-rsO-Akf2NAA2g.text: Bought a bag of chips and decided to use Yelp for the first time checking in to try the lemon ricotta cookies. The cookies have lemon zest! The cookie part has a cake texture... fresh and moist. I think the cookie and icing parts have a nice ratio.

xCOi9JSSLJ0ZadMAW7xuWg.text: Great food.  Could have been a little hotter; had to request that it be microwaved a little more.  But extremely flavorful and well seasoned.

x8vDz0rTgFcmZ_kFnC6S4g.text: not sure how good would be as i waited 30 minutes to be told wrong line.  the staff is incredibly rude, several people left due to lack of efficiency

wBp7HP3AbfgKyBHBlQx_5A.text: We really enjoyed pronto. The chicken Panini was great. Our favorite was the Pomodoro meatball soup

FAJQzqC4GRtBAMEbbFRjzw.text: Al a carte - our choices to share were lentil salad ( a surprising sweet dressing), antipasto salad, charred broccolini, baked manicotti (great filling), and baked salmon.  Everything was fresh and good.

NzqNE5o9rBM5jd8yL7OyLw.text: Great pronto food!  I had the pancetta breakfast sandwich and fresh Berries which were amazing.

eUyMyTAsoKKNpO2SDnDtpg.text: Expensive, mediocre food, but for conference attendees at Ceasar's Palace, it's the only conveniently located non-restaurant within 1/2 a mile.

8JR1yKqAbalCJqVrYhngfA.text: Love this place! Great for a quick bite. I've been here a few times and the food and service have consistently been 5 Star so I felt compelled to write a review. It's so bright and welcoming and has a cute cafe vibe. The chicken mixed grill is great if you're trying to eat healthy (order with the mixed veggies). The chicken is juicy and tender. The paninis are excellent - recommend the ham, gruyere & apple (yes Apple!) or the turkey, bacon and avocado. I don't even like bacon and I really enjoyed this sandwich. The coffee is fantastic. I don't know what it is about it but I don't need to add creamer or sugar or anything! The desserts are worth every calorie, especially the cookies! Lemon ricotta, chocolate chips, black & whites....

fergZFcGShsBYeYSyF3w-A.text: Very disappointing with what they had to offer.  The sandwich had a piece of chicken and was stuffed with arugula.  Wonder if arugula was cheap that day!  "Beef Sandwich" was okay except for the spicy sauce. The pesto sandwich was totally forgetable.  Overall taste-wise. it was boring.  Will never go here again!

1qSbr6Ee3XHltpna1YbrIQ.text: Great service...fast....and good food. Try the triple chocolate cake...you wont be sorry

AgMqd1pJNNml4Jt1fHpcsw.text: Lemon ricotta cookies are amazing. Will be back again to try the food and coffee! Fast service.

94dwnqxC2EL2g8eJxrHs2g.text: I was excited to try Giada's latest Las Vegas venture. My mama and I needed our morning caffeine fix after staying overnight at Caesar's. It was a ridiculous amount of $ to purchase the Keurig kit for our hotel room ($15) so Giada's Pronto was our solution. It was simple enough to order. I went to the express coffee line. I ordered my mom the house coffee ($5), and iced mocha ($7) and a chocolate croissant (that had some fancy name) ($6), making our grand total $19. The bonus was checking into Yelp, which in return got me 3 of Giada's famous lemon ricotta cookies for free. The coffee/mocha were very strong and appreciated. The warmed croissant had a fair amount of chocolate. The cookies were a tad bit too sweet (even for this sweet tooth) and halfsies were shared between my mom and I. The reason for 3 stars versus 4 was the price. However, I guess it's expected, with the celebrity chef name and location on The Strip. I would go here again and would try something different next time around.

IaOQcF7q2EWK0OZUwdaXyA.text: This is a Burger King (all food is pre-made and warmed in a microwave) with Caesars Palace prices.  Was not too impressed...my sandwich was cold so I had to send back (not sure how you get this wrong, it's simply put in a microwave, set & forget) probably won't be back, sad that Giada has her name on this...

5DwtvBzF8Kcc8TwSc2Te-A.text: Really fun casual restaurant. We love watching Giada on TV so this experience was really exciting. The gelato was delicious. Highly recommend to stop in for a quick bite.

UEQPmgcxDeYZ6zHNUmvpgw.text: Not impressive at all, but good enough to sit for awhile. The pastries and bread were stale not unlike supermarket's baked goods. The coffee is ok though.

ZD4Ywvc6pI3wW3T_Pwbvlw.text: Pronto by Giada Las Vegas is absolutely amazing, we had the best service. We had coffee and breakfast there every morning for 3 days. We also enjoyed the wine  bar for 2 evenings. We also sampled the Gelato. Delicious! Good prices for great food! We just loved it!

VLgI7hb5C-fByS2P0KkGYg.text: the cookies are to die for. i hate lemon flavored things but WOW they were amazing. it tastes more like lemon-zest rather than biting into a lemon with sugar. make sure to pick them up for free!! the sandwiches are small and expensive but i'm giving her a 4 because of those cookies

flgG8iegqkjEGEb2VFkn8g.text: Went to Pronto because I follow Giada on Instagram, cook recipes from her cookbooks and have visited Giada at the Cromwell and I love it all. We were on a short trip to Vegas from Los Angeles. We discussed stopping to get a bite to eat during our 3 and a half hour drive. It was my idea to try Pronto because the Instagram posts and I had missed it on my last visit to Vegas. We got into Vegas and drove straight to Caesar's. We parked in the wrong valet and did the long trek to the spot where the much awaited experience of one of Giada's creations was. Once we arrived our excitement quickly diminished as we saw the foods offered. We tried to stay positive as our eyes were disappointed with what we saw. Oh and did I mention, two people in our 5 person group are from Naples, Italy We ordered, and paid $95.00 for 2-sandwiches, 1-bag of chips, 1-lemon cake, 1- roasted potatoes, 1-cup of pesto pasta, 1-small side of olives and 2 sodas and a cappuccino. The pricing was absurdly disappointing but not even close to the disappointment of the food! The only good food choices were the kettle chips and the lemon cake. The pasta had no flavor, the sandwiches were just ok. The potatoes were just okay. Wasn't worth the money but more importantly this place isn't a good representation of Giada and that's what was most discouraging. Will never return to this food place. And I'm sad.

MUlQ6lbVUdpP-Ai5VtGAxg.text: Check in on Yelp and get the free lemon cookies!!!    They are SOOO Melt in your mouth good.     This is a fast fresh option for delicious food in the casino.   It's a walk up counter where you order and get your food and take it to go or sit at one of their tables.     The food is so delicious.   We each got something different and every bite of it was amazing.   Fresh, fresh ingredients, delicious seasoned items.   You can't go wrong here!!!

bVArWHXsdSCyPPuES-h6KA.text: I would say hands down that this is my favorite go to place in the caesar palace to eat. Fast easy and good. I can eat and not feel guilty. Its alot cheaper than alot of restaurants on the strip and in its own casino. I usually get the antipasti egg sandwich or spicy sausage and spinach egg sandwich. You cant beat a giant bowl of soup and in house made rustic bread. And its only $6. What a deal. As for dessert... mascarpone cheesecake are huge for6. The sin city chocolate chip cookies are good and so are their famous lemon ricotta cookies.

42Wkq8zCbC-VqdnAHpKC3A.text: Anitpasto pasta salad was delicious Green olives,tomatoes,pesto and a hint of spice I was so looking forward to the ricotta cookies that they ran out.  Vilma gave me 3 chocolate chips instead

CAKz5GTKs1G-vyjz767Bow.text: In the heart of Caesar's Palace you'll find a breath of bright fresh air at Pronto.  Literally, it smells so good as you walk by and the natural lighting transports you to a lovely place.  We stopped for a snack of gelato and we can't ever pass up trying a tomato soup.  We got their signature Pomodoro Meatball soup, and the Coconut mint chocolate chip Gelato.  We didn't expect the wham of goodness that was coming!!    First of all, the soup.  They had fresh Parmesan cheese and a drizzle of olive oil atop straight, fresh pomodoro soup.  No cream, no fuss, just a perfect acidic balance of tomatoes.  Then there were these mini meatballs the size of grapes that were little surprises.  This soup was succulent.  So delicious!  But paired with gelato, oh boy.  The Gelato was the biggest surprise for us.  This was THE best gelato we've had and let me tell you why.  The flavor profile of mint and coconut with a light vanilla based cream was divine.  But the Star was the abundance of very thin, small, dark chocolate flakes that added a crunch that was so easy to bite into.  We went back later because the temptation was too strong!  So good!   But here's the kick.  These two items together were perfectly harmonious and for sure made us say Mmmmmmm way too many times!  I'd trample through a dozen people to get to this experience again!  Okay, maybe I'm being dramatic but it was that good!

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut Mint Chocolate Chip Gelato!

They do have wide variety of other items as well. I would recommend their lunch special and is probobly bank for your buck.

OK7Hzi1ux58o1N89W2pLqg.text: We're fans of Giada's other restaurant, so were excited to have lunch at her new fast casual concept at Caesar's Palace. Since the property is so big, just follow the signs for the buffet and it's right next door.  We had a hard time deciding, but ultimate ended up getting a few items to experience a little bit of everything. I really enjoyed the turkey, avocado and bacon panini - there was a nice sauce on it that really nailed it for me. It's a little on the pricier side, but it will leave you feeling satisfied, but not overly stuffed. The pastas were great, the Antipasto Pasta Salad was the favorite because we're big fans of the pesto and we really enjoyed the margarita pizza, too!  Make sure you check-in on the Yelp app as you'll get some of the best Lemon Ricotta Cookies you've ever had. I was about to buy some before noticing the sign, but I'd happily pay money for these again. Not only are they tangy from the citrus, they're light, airy and make you want to lick your fingers when you're done.  We'll definitely be back, especially for one of their cocktails and other sandwiches!

0nkZzKKGAVMgNDqtX_UQlA.text: Great place to get a quick but very tasty breakfast. My boyfriend and I were staying at Cesar's palace and we wanted a quick and easy breakfast. I've always wanted to try Giadas places so this was the perfect opportunity! I got the caprese panini and my boyfriend got the steak with potatoes and brocollini! They were both really ready! The panini was crispy and filled with cheese, basil, and tomatoes. The steak was tender and lovely. We also got some vanilla lattes and the yelp check in for cookies!   The only thing was our breakfast cost me $56! But then again everything is expensive in Vegas!   Great place! Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5d_liMy9SrE85ptFb4EH0A.text: I had purchased a couple of the brunch with unlimited mimosas Groupon's for Pronto by Giada knowing that my mom, sister, and I would be spending the majority of our time in Caesar's Palace during our family girls trip last month. The reviews are fairly average so I wasn't totally sure what to expect other than it not being one of the big, fancy Vegas buffet's.   I was thrilled to find that it was located right at the bottom of the elevators to our room, so we were not rushed to make it to our 10:00am reservation on Saturday morning. Speaking of, I'd definitely recommend a reservation. It's very small and it was quite full on a Saturday. They were very accommodating with my mom's scooter as I had put that on our reservation notes, so they had the perfect table set up for us that she was able to park it in a niche right next to our table.   As aforementioned, this is by no means a huge buffet, but I am surprised by the poorer reviews on here. We actually all thought it was a nice break from the craziness that is Vegas. It was quiet, relaxing, and honestly just the perfect mellow morning breakfast. There isn't an enormous amount of options, but there is an omelet station with plenty of ingredients to choose from, a meat station in which you can get slices of turkey, ham, and/or roast beef, breakfast potatoes, bacon, quiche, a pastry bar, a fruit bar, and a dessert bar. The chef cooking our omelets was great. They only have bacon and ham as meat options for the omelets, but I do not eat pork so he suggested taking a small slice of the roasted turkey from the other bar and chopped it up to cook in my omelet. It was delicious! The three of us left stuffed, despite the "lack of options" as people have said. Our mimosa's were always full and my mom's coffee always hot.   In fact, we liked Pronto by Giada so much, we ended up going back for the breakfast buffet again on Sunday. They did not have any reservations available when I looked Saturday night, but they were able to squeeze us in a smaller table. The waitress and the omelet chef remembered us and made us feel very welcomed back!   Next time I stay in Caesar's Palace, I will absolutely be keeping an eye out for the Pronto by Giada Travelocity or Groupon deals!

FpfaxhPllW_9Y4ow0MIRrQ.text: Genuine love and warmth are words that I would use to describe this beautiful food concept. When I think of really good food Italian cuisine comes to for thought. The idea of delivering delicious "real" food was the fruition of the chef who made this happen.  Italian cuisine evokes a place that is comforting it wraps one up in that favorite blanket and holds them close. It is a feeling of closeness and tenderness that I feel as we got close to this cafe.   Located in Caesars Palace as you come through the main entrance where check in is located for hotel guests; take the first hallway all the way around (not towards Omni, the other way) it's on the right. It's set up cafe style as I said earlier, while many patrons were stopping by for real good food to go, some opt to stay as we did!   As I approached Pronto I was blown away by all of the precious detail that was included in the dining room decor, plus the wonderful selection of delicious choices and flavors of beverages just to start with. Let's start in the lobby, while it's not the biggest place to sit, it's size is comparable to a Starbucks lobby is anywhere USA. The chairs and tables are decorated in a beautiful pattern with bright orange. It screams luxury and then we must sit and see if the seat is just as comfortable as it should be. Coziness achieved the seats are ready for one to enjoy your favorite app or instagram posting, game with a cappuccino or glass of wine.   Peace even if just for a minute or too is hard to find in Las Vegas, especially inside one of the busiest hotels in the world. Pronto is tucked in the back of Caesars with very little if not any gambling casino games to destroy your zen while sipping cappuccino trying to achieve Nirvana! The chairs and booth seats are all comfy just waiting for you to stop by! As I sat here I enjoyed the satisfaction of silence here. The ambiance of the place that is was created is utter repose and a fantastic escape from the casino and noise.   While I was browsing the food, the many choices it's way too hard to choose from. If you enjoy sparkling water and upscale luxury dining with having not to make a reservation this is the place to visit. They are over stocked with some of my favorites such as Fentimans Rose Lemonade or Pellegrino Sparkling Water. The food selection is as abundant as their beverage selection. The line is set up where you start at one end and grab and go what you need as you move in line. The selection of food behind the counter is such items as simple sandwiches, pasta, Italian favorites to make one feel good and happy with delicious flavors filling them up. As one nears the register the gelato is the last delicious item and oh so tempting!   As I paid for my sandwich, cheesecake, and sparkling water I am elated with the speed and quality of the front counter service. The cashiers are speedy and very professional. They smile and are so very warm. It's nice to have a cashier that's happy while they are working and interacting with their fellow employees! The crew of Pronto are amazing! Thumbs up to some of the best team work that I have seen in some time . While I was paying for my purchases the manager was restocking the water, she wished me a blessed day without me even speaking to her. This is the kind of presence of team work that should be the blueprint for every company. When the crew and customers are happy then it's smooth sailing. Cruise in and come see how a proper ship is run!  Desert is always first or at least a bite! Wanting to try the cheesecake so much I opened the container and inserted the fork. Here we go real Italian cheesecake. The bite of the cheesecake was not good enough to make a decision if it was good; it took three bites. Yes, the cheesecake here is a wonderful winner! The cheese is so smooth and delectable. I'm not much for crust, but the graham crackers were delicious with perfect balance to the cheesecake pairing together. The sandwich that I had was a fantastic wonder of salami, pepperoni, and provolone cheese served warmed. The sensation from the cheesecake was still filling me with warm fuzzy joy! The sandwich was awesome but compared to the cheesecake it does not hold up. Eventually, I will try everything on the menu.   Now with my visit coming to a close I want to thank Pronto for the free Yelp check in they provide to us. The check in was a fantastic lemon cookie with three in a package. These lemon cookies are no joke, really they are amazing; especially with sparking wine! When you need just a minute to yourself this is the bliss you are seeking! Come and enjoy yourself with real food that is delicious and delivered in a really ready way; Pronto!!

XODuQY44WKUluW7FTC0BRQ.text: My boyfriend and I were at the Cesar hotel and had to stop by Pronto's for a cocktail. We are huge fans of Giada! We had sat at the bar and I had ordered the Bellissimo cocktail and it was to die for! I highly recommend this drink if you like fruity cocktails. The Bellissimo cocktail is listed on the menu under Giada's favorites.   The cocktail was made with the following ingredients: Cruzan, aperol, simple syrup, freshly squeezed lemon juice, and muddled strawberries and basil. The value of the cocktail was $14. I found the price decent for being in a high end Las Vegas hotel.   Our server was very sweet and gave some wonderful tips of what to do and sight see in Las Vegas! I was pleased with the service, friendly staff, and the yummy cocktail. Thank you for a great experience! We will be definitely coming back soon!

We shared a cheese danish, $6. It was really good, light and not overly sweet. Even Hubby likes it.  I love her shows but she makes tiny bites of food and if I were her guest, I'd starve. They have offering for breakfast, lunch and sweets.

8I7U1lp2pG2y28A97d0Oxg.text: Delicious food and great hours. Did the breakfast buffet and it was reasonably priced, for Las Vegas and tasty. Staff is always amazing and went over and above even at night.

3jqlLQMhFMEcLXLMk6vG-Q.text: Sure, this place is pricey but what place on the Strip isn't? And the customer service isn't a best but...The pistachio cannoli was absolutely delicious and so were the lemon cookies. This is definitely a place I'll visit again before departing.

6R_dm56XOh1KlWLaak7auw.text: One of The worst breakfast sandwiches I've ever eaten. They took the egg and pancetta sandwich out of the refrigerator and microwaved it. I waited in line for almost 30 minutes, so by the time I got it, it was cold. I've had a better breakfast at McDonald's, and could have saved $14. Don't go.

CuW2EuLAlzjBkYh_q0bqpg.text: I came to Las Vegas to eat from the BEST THING I EVER ATE in Las Vegas menu and I found this little gem.   On my way to the Caesars Palace Pool I stopped for a bite to eat. I had the Ham, Gruyere & Apple Panni and chicken broth soup. The soup was so delicious, I returned later for a small cup before retreating to bed. And guess who I met at that time... yes, the lovely GIADA herself. She made my day. What a nice lady and her food is delicious!   The chicken broth soup is now THE BEST THING I EVER ATE in Las Vegas. It has tiny pasta, tiny carrots and onions that made my heart happy. Simple and delicious!   Today, leaving the Caesars pool, I'm having the lemon cookies and apple sparking water.

fw65rYjzqBfj3ADYedia6g.text: I really wanted to love this because I used to watch Giada on TV for a bit. However, it's a standard sandwich/coffee shop.  Good if you need to get something quick, but pricey for what you get. Skippable in my opinion with all the other options around.

DoTPxcFBLFFbPWIO9gQ9GA.text: Fresh, pretty and tasty. My teens liked the smoothies and the coffee was smooth. If I had more time, I would've opted for the entrees. After overspending for substandard food and rude service at the food court of Caesar's palace, I wish I'd seen this restaurant before I made that stomach churning mistake. The service was friendly and fast. Next time I'm in this casino, I'll be sure to try more than their liquid options.

PzWcrVLhHqcUDjH1jWRDug.text: This is my go to place for the CinemaCon, their grilled veggies and parmesan potatoes are great, coffee is very good too. Sad that they serve only in plastic boxes even when eating there, plates would be much nicer

EObkXnITEttNeRkrNUp6SQ.text: Straight up the best iced mocha that I have ever had.  Also, the lemon ricotta cookies are crazy good, and stay moist for over a week.

sfwNrcTS3EP9Q8DDDTHVQg.text: Average place in Caesers Palace that serves snacks and coffee. You get free cookies with a Yelp check in! the pizza I had was ok and the coffee was decent. good place for a cheap (by vegas standards only) snack.

Cc-ga145bXEbKExsjHmoyA.text: I needed breakfast before a trade show. I got the egg, spinach and sausage sandwich and a bottle of water to go. It cost me $20+ Once I got the sandwich, it barely had sausage and was super cold in the middle. I asked for them to reheat it. They gave me a new sandwich which was lukewarm in the middle. Super disappointing for the price. Guess they figure a celebrity chef can warrant 2x an expected price?

2mU4g6kD9wp46BXBfzFKNw.text: Absolutely Terrific Brunch!! Today was the first time that I tried  Pronto by Giada's brunch And it won't be the last time! The food was terrific and the service is a plus.  The amount of food and quality of food does not match anything that I've had yet so far in Las Vegas.  I live in Las Vegas, and I want to make sure any Saturday or Sunday that I am vailable from 9 AM to 1 PM that I make this a routine brunch.  The egg white oneket that the Chef madexto order for me was absolutely divine! Do not miss the cranberry turkey as it is moist and delicious and the sauce provided is out of this world.  The desserts to say the least are scrumptious.  In particular, I'm a big fan of the lemon cake as well as the cheesecake and multicolored Neapolitan cake.

QP3jl0WbAYttFmz6_7Brtw.text: Stayed at Ceasars Palace for a week and this place was my go to for coffee, yummy breakfast sandwiches and of course dessert! Even though they get so busy, the staff here makes sure to get in your order ASAP! Free check in Lemon Ricotta Cookies was definitely my favorite!

kuf6emosUsUuAqmnjOmbkA.text: Love the lemon risotto cookies they ate the best!!  Everyone is so nice and reasonable prices.

av2N9ODdx0Osmaai90GRkQ.text: Had a lovely experience during a stacation! The gentleman who assisted me had such a kind and genuinely friendly demeanour. I got the Nutella eclair and it was so good! The pastry was perfectly light and the creme was so airy. I loved the sweet and toasty hazelnuts on top!   The lemon ricotta cookies are so good! I really appreciated the check in offer. A wonderful way to try something new!

9WtZ4LpVQSMm2atX547ufA.text: Lemon chiffon cake was so good! Totally worth the trip to Caesars. Also picked up my free pack of lemon ricotta cookies which were also very yummy. Pretty shocked at the price of coffee here tho so we skipped that!

GKwWPZliiLMXw3ffMFQaMg.text: The food was good, I wouldn't say great, and was really overpriced. I paid $21-22 for a turkey sandwich and drink. You would think the sandwich would have to be something special for that price, but it wasn't - just a baguette with turkey and cheese - that's it. I wouldn't eat there again.

faD4OUu0gnYIdj4CViNhWw.text: OMG perfect mid afternoon treat...lemon ricotta cookies and a cold brew coffee! The cold brew coffee may have been the best I've ever had!  I added Just a splash of cream on top but it was so lovely and balanced and paired perfectly with the famous lemon ricotta cookies!! Get extra to have later!

jUYGFjceiI4n8Yh5YBodOw.text: What a letdown. Very indifferent and unhelpful staff. Expect a basis of wine knowledge. Food just fast food out of wrapper. Place was empty as it should be. Wine poured from bottle flat and tasted like it had been setting around for days.   Nothing good to say

wX1WFzf_iuuwzV_7UX4zQQ.text: Love Giada's restaurant and wanted to try this quick-service version.  After paying $50 for a couple sandwiches, we notice all the cafe tables were taken.  Luckily, a sign we just after the pay counter offered "additional seating" at the wine bar, just around the corner with plenty of available seats.    Halfway through our sandwiches Juli came up and said we had to leave.  I pointed out the signs, which she acknowledged (and had someone promptly take down the temporary kiosk ones...Pic of permanent one attached), but still said we needed to leave.     As an owner of multiple, multi-unit service businesses this poor customer service is a direct result of POOR MANAGEMENT, something even great food can't overcome long term.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another sign offering &#34;additional seating,&#34; this one permanent (in addition to the temporary signs they had standing to offer the same).

6ICiviPWdl40iApf2qd51Q.text: This is an awesome quick serve place. If you check in on yelp they will give you 3 free lemon cookies. Giada's food is awesome.

wLwmEfgIMb90_QcEakMUWw.text: Had brunch here today due to Uncork'd event in Vegas & birthday girls weekend. We made reservations a month ago. Showed up early for our 11:00 reservations. We did not get seated till noon. The hostess was not friendly & the only one bussing the tables (short staff & slowly). The food was cold, even under heat lamps. The only good hot food was the omelet bar. We had to summoned a waitress to get drinks. I was so disappointed because we were treating a friend for her birthday & it completely embarrassed me that we had chosen this place for brunch. Maybe because it was "Giada" place I was expecting more. :(

But not everybody gets that gift. Do they?   Classic rock music playing above loudly. Contemporary seating layout. Fantastic customer service.

sXGM9IybsBgQCwRoRMUUvA.text: Expensive. Food ain't great. Better selection elsewhere for the price.   Yeah - the pronto doesn't do it for me. Won't be going back.  Good coffee though.

HgfRdhjpjz9i1AnukoFwWA.text: Yo, did I really just pay 27 dollars for a bottle of water and a sandwich that was pre-made?  Wtf Giada... Go to subway and get your H2O from CVS.

Z56bmNmY-Aa0WoIxElommA.text: Wow! Where shall I start, every dessert looks amazing! Seriously, even l ones I don't typically like look delectable. We settled on the lemon ricotta cookies. Unknowingly at the time we decided upon these scrumptious treats, the check-in offer was for a free package. #winning The cannolis were exquisite! One type was graced with chocolate chips, another with pistachio and the last with what appeared to be cherry flavored. It took serious restraint not to leave with the pistachio one! In addition to redeeming the free cookie offer, I purchased a small coffee. $6.48, YIKES! When in Vegas.... The coffee condiment bar was neat and well organized. I was pleased to see cinnamon was an option. The coffee was good and paired well with the cookies. The venue itself was very clean and the desserts and pastries were well organized in pristine cases. Finally, our cashier was very personable. I would definitely return. I encourage fellow Yelpers to take advantage of the check-in offer. I almost forgot! The gelato bar features gelato cannolis! Say whhaaaaattt???

Ex6N_loRJ-Vmhf7bY65JXg.text: Both of her restaurants are disappointing.   I really enjoy watching Giada's show so was excited to try her food in real life. I wonder how often she stops by to check the quality of the food being served at her namesake spots. I wrote another review for Giada's at the Cromwell. But this is for the little spot inside Caesar's.   I must say that I didn't try the wine bar section. I stopped by where they had food already prepared. It's called Pronto, and I just wanted something fast for breakfast. I chose the Pancetta and Egg sandwich, added hashbrowns, and also got an orange juice. Plus tax it came out to almost $24. I know it's Vegas casino pricing. But $7 for a cup of orange juice?! The sandwich was very bland and dry. It needed some sauce or a cheese that would add some flavor. I couldn't eat it or the hash brown. I did drink the oj, but because I was thirsty. It was supposedly freshly squeezed, but didn't take particularly great to me.   I would never eat here again. Caesar's has many other options, like the food court that is reasonably priced and much tastier.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Overpriced.

w6LylgagPIv5wT_TCHbXQg.text: Disappointed to say the least. I could hardly find the spot and several employees of Caesars' could not direct us to this joint. I was expecting a totally different scene. Aside from her name and cookbooks everywhere, it didn't scream "Giada" to me. Her main restaurant was my favorite but the only plus side to this restaurant was that with a Yelp checkin, you receive her signature ricotta cookies!  I ordered the tiramisu which was light and airy and the bf ordered the lemon basil sorbet. The sorbet was so so. There were only 8 flavors to choose from any nothing really stuck out. It's definitely a "pronto" spot; pre-packaged meals and pastries. Meh.

UAXU3UhCshJZ_R5s8384Bg.text: Eh.. This is the second Pronto we've been to with the first being in the newly opened Pronto at the Wynn Palace Cotai Strip. Wait.. take that back. While the Pronto at Wynn Palace is the same name as Pronto by Giada, is it really the same restaurant? Both serve exactly the same stuff with the same furniture. Who knows...  The food here is slightly elevated fast food. If you are in a pinch of something fast, then like the name of the restaurant hints, this is where you want to be. However remember that you're paying ridiculous pricing already here at Caesars. $17 for a sandwich that's pre made and didn't taste that good isn't really good at all. Everything here is expensive, as expected.  Even if you need a coffee, do yourself a favor, go over to Brioche by Guy Savoy. Just a few steps over and much better and cheaper.  Actually, if you want fast food, skip this and walk over to the food court. For the price, Halal Guys or Earl of Sandwich are much better.

Qlk7Bd4TM-C_HTfiuVhtdQ.text: I stumbled upon Pronto while wandering through Caesars Palace.  Giada's photos are displayed in the cafe, which was what caught my eye. For those not into celebrity chefs, Giada de Laruentiis is on the Food Network, makes appearances on the Today Show, and is known for Italian cooking.  I had been to Giada's restaurant at the Cromwell several times, which is an absolutely beautiful restaurant, with stunning views of the Strip.  Pronto is more like a cafe, with no views except the inside of the casino, and where you order at the counter and seat yourself.     The lemon ricotta cookies are an Italian classic, and came with a Yelp check-in.  They were delicious! They were topped with a lemon glaze, and the ricotta clearly gave it a nice pillowy cake-like texture.  Ricotta always works wonders in Italian cooking!! Think manicotti, mascarpone, and zeppole.  I'd easily purchase these next time.  However, did you know that the recipe for this is on the Food Network? Yup, you can even make these at home!  I personally prefer the orange flavored version of these Italian cookies, but Giada's were darn good!  I contemplated grabbing a pizza since I've had enjoyable meals at Giada's at the Cromwell, but they didn't look aesthetically appealing to me.    Pronto is super casual.  It's a self-serve spot where you'd grab a sandwich or pizza for lunch there, or get it to go.  However, they just started their buffet brunch ($45.00) this weekend.    As an aside, I've always wondered how or why "pronto" got translated into meaning fast or quick in the U.S.  In Italy, it means ready.  For example, Italians answer the phone by saying "pronto" instead of "hello", which loosely means "I'm ready".  Well, I guess Giada is sticking with the well-known American meaning of pronto here, so I will too.  More lemon ricotta cookies please, pronto!

xcMv4z9j93_nQOACkqQUJg.text: I had to work at this property for a one week long event. I wanted to eat lunch and stumbled upon Pronto. I purchased several items including a piece of chocolate cake. Holy smokes! *Eye roll* Pronto has the BEST chocolate cake I've ever eaten. The next day I had lunch at Pronto again and I bought another piece of chocolate cake (to go). By the end of the week I bought another two pieces of cake so I could share the experience with my family and friends.  My event ended, so that meant no more easy access to Pronto during lunch.   Buuuut  I was still thinking about chocolate cake . Sooo, yes I drive about 15 miles to buy a piece of chocolate cake when I'm craving it.    5/13/19 Was craving this deliciousness.  I've included a oictu 5/14/19 Today too... Lol  5/15/19 No Chocolate cake today instead I wanted to try the Affogato!  Here's the pictures. I was not impressed with their presentation and portion size for the price. $8 & some change. Ahh what?     I should have at least gotten two scoops of vanilla gelato.   Overall- The espresso with vanilla gelato was good. But when you get to the bottom of the cup with just the espresso, it was strong and bitter tasting. I didn't finish it.  Would I order this again? Probably, hoping I'd get a bit more gelato.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A little bit for the price.
Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Affogato- I received it like this.
Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another piece of deliciousness.

4qqOmk0SzLLBR7nFB9rA0Q.text: The prompt service here made my day more than The Terminator robot has ever made anyone's day. The GF and I were acknowledged and seated immediately. Reservations still have a meaning at Pronto; they're for more than not waiting as long to be seated. The staff actually attend to those who have reserved spots. For once, I felt like a paying customer.  All the breakfast fare here dazzles the palate. The chamomile tea was mellow. The potatoes scrumptious. The pesto pasta salad pleased to the last forkful. A genteel chef manned a prime rib station. The prime rib melted off the bone. I went back to that particular station for thirds. The charcuterie board contained all the finest meats and cheeses. I will never forget the prosciutto.  As for the lemon ricotta cookies, I will always savor their memory. Each morsel elevated me to the empyrean heights of everlasting lemon flavor. Giada's recipe for these cookies is a study in culinary perfection. I would eat these cookies by the baker's dozen. Pretty much every reviewer thus far praised the lemon ricotta cookies. These cookies can bring strangers to a meaningful consensus better than some modern political systems. I look forward to more sweet and sour flavors harmonizing on my plate in the not too distant future. At Pronto Giada's, you'll get a lemon...ricotta.  Although I was not paying much attention because of the lemon ricotta cookies, I did notice that Lisa Vanderpump walked by Giada's en route to her Vanderpump Cocktail Garden. The whole event could have been staged, but she has reduced a lot of her reality to reality TV, so what is the difference?  The majority of the women at Giada's switched into fangirl mode, which freed up more space by the table with the lemon ricotta cookies. OMNOMNOMNOMNOMNOM. (Lisa looked famous. Good for her.)

MGg5YuJwmXISQx7n7CEoug.text: This place is pretty good. Located inside Caesars palace behind the casino toward the Towers. We enjoyed a coffee and some pastries. I checked in on Yelp and they delivered the best tasting lemon cookies! Absolutely delicious. Very soft and moist and not super sweet! House Coffee wasn't very strong like Starbucks. But I like it that way. I hate leaving all shaky like I need to run back to my room and do some exercise! Lol  Pastries were heated to the touch and I loved the berry and cheese pastry. 1 Star taken off for the slow service. They forgot my son's bagel and passed it on to the adult standing next to him. I had to go up and demand my son's bagel because the cashier said "she didn't see him." Hence the delay on getting our bagel right away. That's ok but I don't like how they get your bagel from the wall shelf that's been sitting their since 5am or whatever time they open. I'd prefer my bagel from a sealed bag or a glass case.

sC0KoO58I7W6WSjxzxm7CA.text: Don't know when's the last time I got so irritated.  1) took me 15 minutes to order when there were only 5 people in front of me. They're so slow and understaffed.. there were only two people working  2) the worker lost the ice cream scooper and was looking through the trash for it 3) I ordered a large iced americano and they gave it to me hot. My friend went back and told the girl who took my order that I asked for it iced and the girl said "yeah I know". She knew the guy made it incorrectly and gave it to us anyway. What the heck? It's one thing if you got it wrong but it's another thing if you purposely gave me the wrong order.  4) I looked at the cups displayed and realized they charged me for a large but they gave me a medium.   I'm soooooo mad. Absolutely hate this place

6VQESju2-m10VZ5RmKxZKg.text: I'm rating this as a sit down cafe... it's not as good if you are trying to get a quick to-go coffee as it is simply too slow.  For sit down breakfast/brunch/lunch it is a perfect complement to the buffet across the hall.  Here you can get a quick (relatively) meal at a reasonable (Las Vegas reasonable) price.  Fair warning; they manage this by heating premade food for some dishes.  The paninis are cooked to order in normal presses.  They have a reasonable selection but I do not believe you can customize... again they have them assembled prior and just cook them when ordered.  The frittatas are pleasantly surprising! I couldn't see if they were frozen and reheated, premade that morning and reheated, or pre-assembled into wedge shaped containers and flash cooked in an oven; but certainly they weren't made from scratch at the time of my order... it was simply too fast for that.  Same discussion applies to the hash browns.  Which brings up the above comment regarding the coffee... despite not being busy my cappuccino wasn't ready until LONG after my meal was.  Clearly either an issue with understaffing or their process.   Regardless this place is worth a stop for a quick bite to eat if you can't imagine eating a full buffet across the hall!

dTJV4VLrTxLmOJ-AqWBQgg.text: Biggest waste of money. Lobster roll was disgusting. Took the lady behind the counter 3 times to make my panini. (The first one she threw away and the second was still frozen). Overpriced on top of it all.

qI8J1lCMZ3zbLFdTOGeszQ.text: We bought gelato around 10:30. Place looks so cheap, Decore is not inviting. They were out most gelatos. I got 2 separate small cups of gelato. Lady charged me $9.75. Was ok tasting, but it was 1/3 of regular scoop I would get anywhere else. My husband and I were so disappointed. We went trevi restaurant and got one scoop, almost same price, but 4 times more gelato. I can't believe Giada would allow to rob someone and serve that small scoop. I stayed Caesar's palace 3 more days. I did not buy anything anymore from prontogiada. Place looks so so cheap.

ROGwtJoT72w_VvdD7oQdnw.text: Picture the Pre-made section of Whole Foods with Giada's name on it. The cold salads were good, but if you get an entree it is reheated in a fancy microwave. Kind of a bit pricy for that. The chicken was surprisingly good, DON'T get the steak. It comes out almost grey after it's spin in the Heating machine. The saving grace would be the desserts and gelato. The chocolate cake was amazing. Super moist and fudgey!! Skip the meal and have dessert. Didn't think it was worth the high prices but you can't put a price on a good dessert.

h7aF2KnVKkuxSGKRM__lug.text: It's fine. Just fine, if you need quick food that's decent. Service was friendly they worked fast, which I appreciated. The lemon grilled cheese panini was interesting. It has a nice lemon flavor. Almost $7 for a ginger ale, which is obscene.

vvDW4_jUc6onaDJDDnsMew.text: Pronto looked promising, and my partner had a very good cappuccino but an extremely salty "detox" soup left us thinking Pronto was not so great. Who knows, maybe it was an off day (one has to imagine something went wrong in the kitchen). Still, I won't be going back. Too many other options...

EqyiynUZxR39gZmLGfp0KQ.text: the sandwiches were dry, the drinks were way overpriced (like everything else on the menu) the chicken soup was just salty water with some chives, the pizza was literally bread and a slice of tomato and some tasteless sauce.

stYctbe7Tq7r25x8JMVvLQ.text: I visit the strip quite often and always on the go when I am down there. The strip food joints typically cater to the tourists, which is awesome, but for people like me who have to visit the strip for work-related events, we don't have much time to sit and eat. I realize there are different places to grab quick bites, but the quality of food is usually lacking. In comes Pronto! I was so excited to hear about Giada's new grab and go restaurant. After trying a few items during different visits (lobster roll, turkey provolone sandwich, and artichoke and tuna sandwich), I was not disappointed! One other time, I decided to splurge at the wine bar (After work, of course, ha) and ordered the Cabernet Sauvignon Blend Quintessa Rutherford. Delicious to say the least! The wine bar is nice for a quick after-work drink with colleagues without all the lounge/bar noise of a traditional bar. Overall, great for people who love quality food on the go!

I12NNWzshvYmITSid7NHpQ.text: This cafeteria-style eatery (located inside Caesar's Palace Hotel Casino) was surprisingly good. I loved that most everything on the menu was unique, unlike the typical sandwich fast food restaurant. I had the Giada Signature Muffaletta s/w which was good, except for the fact that I thought the bread was too thick. My lunch mates had the Turkey Avocado Bacon s/w, which they said was delicious. The prices were a bit high, service was quick & the eating area clean & bright. I recommend Pronto, especially if looking for a quick, but tasty meal.

VMdRlB5un9UUDO8FJlJhDw.text: Pronto by Giada is located in Caesars Palace and is close to the pool entrance. This made it the most convenient stop for us when we wanted to grab a quick bite before heading to the pool.   Their sandwiches were amazing and their sweets were just perfect as well. This is a great place to stop to enjoy a light snack or for a poolside meal.  The staff was friendly and amazing! We even learned how to pronounce Giada's name properly!

Only good things were the omelette station and our server. Very disappointed about everything else

The omelette was very average and everyone working there did not seem very happy to be there. There was very limited tables and they were very close to each other. Overall not the experience I was looking for.

pQ6jXZ4BHYPw3OP6dTB-wQ.text: Good selection of baked goods and gelato. Nothing particularly unique about it, but everything tasted good. I would say it's definitely pricier (5 dollars for a crossiant), but it is in Caesars so things are going to be pricier on the strip. I would prefer to go to a nice cafe where there is a view or a patio.

x9mNGAulUAwEtlphzSdT5Q.text: Delicious sandwiches, yogurt and soups! I've eaten here the last 2 days and the flavors are so delicious but I'm sadded by the missing food! I had the turkey avocado panini and there was no sight of avocado... I just had the detox soup which I HIGHLY recommend but my cup was filled less than half way...

Sd1lUNW2J6D0uWBvAgz5eA.text: I think it's ridiculous that you charge $1.50 for a cup of water for a paying customer.  Come on now!!

yBWtpidi-OsqWcJUjmULAg.text: A friend and I were there for Sunday Brunch.  We had reservations and were seated immediately.  Service was appropriately attentive. The food was excellent, particularly the prime rib.  There were a nice variety of different salads, salmon, and shrimp.....lovely cheese and sliced meat options, as well as pastries, and a fresh omelette station.   This is an excellent brunch for the price.  Food was replaced as soon as it was empty and all was hot or cold as necessary.   I will come back.   Reservations are a must, however, as the venue isn't large.

4sg-eXUSBYxUGQbACuy4zw.text: Great place to swing by for a juice cleanse. I got the pineapple kale smoothie. It brought back life to me after a night out drinking in Vegas. I also tried their americano which was solid. If you check in with Yelp, then you can also get lemon ricotta cookies.

0Ye8ctmtYawIwcNKMRphbQ.text: Amazing! I've eaten here everyday this week. Added a new wine to my favorites list. Had the Margarita pizza which was Amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IyiPD2WR5FgzLJCZJbOGdA.text: I've watched every one of her TV cooking shows. Everytime I'm at Caesars Palace I have to go to Pronto and get a package of the Lemon Ricotta cookies. I've followed the recipe and made my own but somehow it's never the exact same as hers.

2EoExlqTFbEN780kja6A9g.text: I made it my mission to make it to Pronto on the day of the Grand Opening. To be honest, I didn't have the highest expectations. Celebrity Chef restaurants can be overrated now. Pronto blew my expectations out of the water.   The design of the restaurant is beautiful. It's comfortable but still classy. There are three sections: quick service cafe, wine bar, and more of a retail store. The retail store was sectioned off for the grand opening, but that's okay. I came for the food.   I had scoured the internet for a menu beforehand, but there wasn't one to be found. I read about the restaurant offering a grilled cheese, so I sought to try that. When I arrived, I was disappointed to see that the grilled cheese had lemon pesto. I am not a fan of lemon, so I passed. I wish it was just pesto. This city is sorely lacking a great chicken pesto sandwich.  All the sandwiches are pre-made, so don't expect to try to subtract any ingredients. I tried. The kind cashier offered to scrape avocado off a sandwich, but I spared her. I ordered the caprese panini.   The panini was the biggest letdown for me here. They add parmesan to the outside of the sandwiches before pressing (which I usually love), but here it seems to only add crunchiness instead of flavor. I would rather they leave this off. I was also surprised to find that the sandwich had arugula instead of basil. I love basil, so this was a big disappointment. The panini also does not have balsamic (which is totally fine with me - I am not a balsamic fan), but this strays from the traditional caprese.   Aside from the panini, I ordered a slew of the baked goods to take home with me. Here are my assessments:  Rosemary pancetta scone - This is a must order. I should have made this my lunch. It's the perfect balance of savory with a slight sweetness.   Chocolate chip cookies - Really solid. They're a touch grainy, but I definitely would still eat them.  Black & White cookies - Pass. These have very little flavor. They're even lacking vanilla.   Blueberry muffin - Easily one of the softest muffins I have ever had. It was like eating a cloud. The blueberry flavor could be a bit stronger, but I still recommend it.   Chocolate Mascarpone Cake - This is a super solid, moist cake packed with chocolate flavor. For me, it was just missing chocolate chips for a bit of texture change.   The prices on the baked goods are more than fair. The sandwich pricing, however, needs a bit of work. They're not worth the high price tag.  Check this place out. The baked goods are definitely worth it. Skip on the sandwiches.

EH2MPRfXLWA3M_IA4ilJcg.text: A bit disorganized.  Understaffed so expect delays during lunch even for a typical spot.

5ThKdb4OtOQ-KiArCk5DIg.text: Superb quality in minutes. I'm telling you, the food melts like BUTTER in your mouth. I've never had chicken so delicious! The grilled Cacciatore chicken is heavenly! You get two sides, of which I chose the grilled vegetables and anti pasta pasta salad. The grilled vegetables were cooked perfectly and so scrumptious!!! I wished I had ordered it twice for my sides. The pasta salad seemed to be of average taste. But delicious nonetheless. I finished it off with a grapefruit sorbet, contained 5% alcohol. Sooo refreshing! Highly recommend. The establishment itself was very nice. Clean, open. Lots of seating. Will definitely be coming back here. Thank you, Giada!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nYpVB-f-EgYNVBDVLFb0HQ.text: If I could give it zero stars I would. Over priced and everything is average. My husband makes Giada's lemon cookies better then they do. Wonder if she even tastes anything from this place. Asked for one scoop of gelato half one flavor half another. They refused to do it said it was policy! What a stupid shortsighted policy. Give the guest what they want what the heck is the difference. Perhaps they are so inept at scooping ice cream they created that policy. Shame on putting your name on such a product Giada.

BZLnABzMvrN45zTR-t0pXw.text: Stumbled upon Giada di Laurentiis's new grab-and-go spot at Caesars Palace as I was looking for something quick to eat--so glad I did!  As an anytime breakfast fiend, I was happy to see an all-day eggs sandwich menu. I ordered the spinach and sausage sandwich. At about 3/4" thick, the egg was a healthy, satisfying portion, with the bits of sausage cooked into the egg, and the sauteed spinach embedded into the toasted bun. The sandwich also comes with mozzarella cheese--yum! The sandwich satisfied my appetite, and you could feel and taste the quality.  I didn't have any beverages here, but there's coffee, tea and bottled water and juice available, too. I want to come back for some gelato or sorbetto!

Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wall decor!
Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach and sausage sandwich. The crumbled morsels of sausage are in the egg patty.

HAOjXeSFaXHn-i0gUQxxhw.text: The Nitro Cold Brew is hands down the best coffee I've ever had. We stayed in the Palace Tower and Pronto is conveniently located from the walk from those elevators to the main casino floor, so naturally I stopped by every morning for a cup. My husband had a cup of the house blend coffee (hot), and that was just as good. If you're a coffee fan, iced or hot, don't pass it up!

Ta2GVzR_FVEI7wF7M3ciIA.text: Very good pastries and coffee. It's also very clean and you get the best lemon cookies for free if you check in at yelp!

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z_2EP9-TfDQJpAz-U_s64Q.text: Got the California chopped salad, shrimp (2), small amount of tomato, corn, zucchini, prosciutto.  Salad dressing with lemon.  Lunch mate had Muffuletta, "tastes OK".  Salad is fresh, pretty tasty.  Line was long but it went fairly fast.  Nice for a quick lunch.

s2pUdA4EeismBQJDdEfgfQ.text: The desserts here are fantastic! I pick up some lemon ricotta cookies here at least once a week and the gelato is probably the best on the strip. They're the same desserts from the Giada Restaurant, but you don't need to drop $$$ on the dinner part to access them.

hMIs-2sW71yv2Zt5MHbdOA.text: Food was good for the price, especially in Vegas.  This is one of the most affordable quick bite places on the strip. The Lemon Ricotta Cookies (they get a 5 star) are the best cookies I've ever eaten. I recommended them to numerous people and each has come back thanking me for telling them. The cookies are so good I have learned to make Giana's recipe at home!

sntaG4Gh37nr5KGkHycjLw.text: Such a missed opportunity for a place bearing Giada's name. Our visit today was so disappointing, we had such high hopes...  Hard to find, very bad restaurant and seating layout.  We had to sit literally 6ft from the noisy slot machines as the other seats were taken.  The employees, although nice, did not know the menu. I got the turkey ciabatta at the recommendation of the cashier.  Tasted fine until my sinuses were cleared by the overpowering spicy mustard. Took it back and exchanged for the ham and cheese ( cashier assured me it didn't have spicy mustard)  Long story short, it did have it, i just tried scraping it off. I did not return it but as we were leaving i told the cashier about the experience. She just smiled and said"thanks for letting me know, i didn't know it had spicy mustard".  Both my husband and i left still hungry. Definitely not coming back. We'll stick to Giada's at Cromwell,  we've gone 6 times and always excellent outstanding all around.

1FGwDcjtiW0duNYOcV3pIw.text: Good, quality food that is prepared quickly but is overpriced for what you get. Otherwise would be 5 stars.

onKDuolBz29-7eRJNjGLzg.text: The cappuccino was on point, the lobster roll to go was fresh and delicious and the lemon ricotta cookies are just as good as everyone says! We even got to see Giada! Quick and tasty spot to grab a quick bite with friends at Caesars. We'll be back.

pp7rVY-OiJusPSYZkK31CQ.text: Not as "Pronto" as I thought but there was a big conference going on. The yogurt parfaits are delicious! Also tried a panini that was pretty good. Good option if your on the go and want some thing quick.

to6gKmHRlgvn25w58lmD9Q.text: We had been looking forward to trying out Giada's new place this past weekend. We were very underwhelmed. First off everything is heated up. Nothing is fresh out of the oven piping hot. The pizza was bland. My husband's sandwich was good. The chicken cacciatore was just okay and the sides were very ordinary. The wine bar is a completely different section and was expensive with small pours and not connected to the restaurant so you stand in two lines. They didn't have Rose so we went with the Sauv Blanc and it was bitter. We checked in on Yelp and got free cookies which were delicious! I hope they are still working out the kinks because we really had been excited to try it

K9rZYW5XkZPPCIJMk5Tl5w.text: Justin was a great server, very helpful and the gelato is amazing!!! This was my first time here and my family and i were very impressed with the taste and quality or service! I would definitely recommend to everyone I know!

sqT35JribjW107eGmmhpEA.text: Absolutely wonderful!! The staff is friendly, and the food... devine!! It is fantastic that is open till 11 so you can go to the show then hit this place up for a treat!!

v1czFakIj7ayP3uWzxbl8g.text: Excellent food, quick service. A must stop for breakfast if staying at Caesars Palace

_jV3RSiZtLoKGk0LQ_8sOw.text: Had lunch here at a break from my conference.  I ordered the ham, gruyere and apple pannini.  There was no apple and way too much mustard.  The mustard totally overpowered everything.  Very disappointed.

Bppc63LNpLT5SkeHQ__A9Q.text: I had the lemon cookies and they were so good I ate all three in one sitting. Don't think they were worth the price point though. $5 for 3 cookies.

U9E5ZaClzJuLcISMkhBKyQ.text: I love this place!!! The gelato and sorbet were delicious. The breakfast pastries.... absolutely to die for. The wine bar.... finally a place for good wine without the attitude....service here is so friendly. Love this place.

51l2sJYaMnhxYOY7khNoUw.text: Great addition to Caesars. Better coffee than Starbucks and the orzo salad is fire. Better food than you'll find most other places if looking for a quick bite.

YNkm28Mku5w6ln6_nhcurA.text: Food is good. Concept is STUPID. You stand around and wait FOREVER for your order. Unorganized. Not a good setup. Could be okay if no one is ever at Caesars. :) Odered NO cheese, got cheese on the sandwich. Grilled veggies were good. In a hurry? Grab some cookies and a coffee and you'll be fine. Look for the tiniest ENTER HERE sign you've ever seen. Wanted to love it. Vegas local.

Y-3SwCsgAIAPNppcCnh0Hw.text: What!!!! They have runner up chef Kristin from HELLS KITCHEN season 15 in the back making food! Awesome. Not only did I see her through the window she waved came out and took a picture with me!!! The food here is fast and accommodating. The venue is absolutely gorgeous and with its bright and bold colors. It's stands out in the palace. Let's not forget to mention that they have a bar around the corner from the lunch and dessert side where they have wine on tap and a full bar. The bartender explained to me that's its on a nitrous system where every time they pull the handle regardless of how long the bottles been there it's like opening a brand new bottle. Awesome!! I'll defiantly be back for some gelato in the summer.

uJpcnc4yKwBUFDUJb5EHDg.text: Awful! Don't waste your money. I had the pesto pasta and lemon grilled cheese panini, yuck to both! My traveling companion had the turkey sandwich and the caprese salad; together we spent about $30! Ridiculous and the food was bad.

TKoChslOeVF65oiyacypqQ.text: Quick service, but chopped salad is far from chopped. It's simply a salad with toppings. Flavor was good, but required chopping in order to enjoy. It's a salad with an identity crisis. The curried chicken panini was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Chopped&#34; salad half way through chopping ourselves.

T6wsXjezbynEDbdL6o8wKw.text: The crab roll is amazing! Service was great! Great authentic food at an affordable price. We will definitely be back!

xkf0jbRhHqBJ9wuD-XJUiA.text: The spicy sausage egg sandwich had excellent flavor and the hash browns were very delicious. Only complaint is that the sandwich was ice cold in the middle.

1nwlfRZjKQwBkHMF6RNlag.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch at Caesar's and actually ate at the main Giada restaurant the other night. Had the roast beef panini and broccolini which were both excellent. Free lemon cookies with a yelp check-in! We will be back!

K1XkiRWSHc7lKSvkqkJY9Q.text: This review is only for the grab and go part of the restaurant not the Wine bar.  We went there just "by accident" on the way to the casino.  We shared a few pastries- the chocolate something, sorry, and the strawberry cream cheese danish and a breakfast sandwich.  The sandwich was very good, for $2 more you can add "hashbrowns".   What delighted me though were the Lemon Ricotta cookies they sell for $5.  If you do the Yelp check-in though they are free and they are delicious!  Will definitely go back and get those cookies even if I have to pay for them.

oSim8c9WdCJnbqsiJ092qg.text: A good overpriced coffee and breakfast spot, but when you need something before the conference, then this is the place.  I paid $15 for a coffee and two small piece of bread. Damn.. it was pricy.

PcbR4OLfFtiMw959riZeYg.text: The lemon ricotta cookies are amazing!!   I've been in Vegas for 5 days and have grabbed something fast and delicious from here on several occasions. Highly recommend!

FUCa91y6Jn8uppTGN2ZkDA.text: Finally a place on the strip that offers convenient casual dining without impacting the quality of food. Truly feels like home; if I didn't know any better, I'd think I was still in NY!  Highly recommended!

uL4fNb4JStgNd5mWzxmSUg.text: Sucks.  Vegan and they had a vegan item on their menu. Asked the guy if it was without animal products. He said "yup". I ate two risotto balls and was sick for two days.  They fry their stuff in one fryer.  It's pricey and on the strip.  For tourists. You can find better off the strip for less money.  Won't be going back anytime soon. The others in my party did like it to be fair but I can't deal with people who don't understand what a vegan menu item is.  At least they didn't try to offer me a chicken salad.  Guess this review isn't long enough to post so I'll go on.  The restaurant was clean and spacious for the strip. If I go back I'll stick with a salad and balsamic/oil.  Don't think I'll be going back though.  The strip is overpriced and overrated for the most part. I'd gladly eat off strip and get a better deal and the same quality of food. I'd say that this place is good for business lunches and dinners or when you have family in town and they want to see the strip.

dYCyPrLdkSk1GlOVixNkag.text: Food that should be hot, is cold. Food that should be cold is warm.  And, man is it ridiculously expensive, even for Vegas.  Breakfast at the Starbucks in the casino is actually cheaper, and so is the coffee.

VqSdZ083kOVn_PHDlWoP6g.text: First, let me just say the lemon ricotta cookies are the BEST you will ever have.  We took advantage of their special offer and loved them!  We also ordered gelato (the pistachio flavor to be exact) which was also excellent. We did not try any of the food, so I can't comment on that.  I'm giving four stars though for the prices on their wines at the wine bar area.  SUPER high end and expensive.  For a walk up and 'order yourself type' of place this seemed out of place.  I mean, if I'm gonna buy a $150 bottle I'd want a a bit more ambiance than what is basically a step above fast food place.

5Lk5EfWe9Dg-1mbRLj7zbw.text: I ate at Pronto twice.  You'd think if you ate somewhere twice it would be better than three stars, but as yelp says about 3 stars it was A-OK.  I will say to have such a celebrity's name on it I would have expected better.  We ate lunch there on our first day while we waited for our room at Ceasars to be ready.  My wife and I split the baked pasta and the Caprese sandwich.  The pasta was good but no better than stouffers.  The sandwich needed more of everything.  More tomato, cheese, basil, and balsamic and less bread.  I left pretty disappointedly, but since it was close to the meeting area I returned for breakfast.  Breakfast was really good.  I had the antipasto breakfast sandwich.  It was amazing.  TheItaliann meats and the redpepper sauce went perfectly with the egg.  Something you rarely hear me bitch about is cost.  The breakfast sandwich was fourteen dollars.  It was 1 dollar worth of deli meat and how much does an egg cost.  Coffee was expensive as well. Having said that if you check in on yelp you get three delicious lemon cookies.  They were great.

GCLugmbadK8x9qYaumhgMw.text: This is way overpriced place to eat at Caesars don't come here if you're expecting a quick cheap meal the soup they gave you in a big container is 98% broth with power do you eat any ingredients a slice of pizza a little square is five dollars.

OPW2yFCjOgST2Bb1yc2gXQ.text: Very Expensive and the food and coffee taste worse than the ones from gas station , the only reason they have business is that they are right across from the buffet and people buy stuff from them to kill time like 2-3 hours wait on the buffet, don't try it, you will regret , don't know how they got the high review, but definitely not from me

ZbGelZUlkaGP8Hx2bfoLWA.text: Slowest service by any restaurant on Strip.  Slloowww.  Will never return.  Giada should be embarrassed.  Food wasn't that great.  Selection was limited.  Waited for nearly 25mins to pay.  Horrible.  Go to Buddy V's instead!

0xP0z4Eu3Va0Qw82cLO3fg.text: I just came here for the cookies...get the sin chocolate chip ones and check in for a free bag of lemon ricotta !

slvJ8oUMtFdRbTgzfypy0Q.text: Ordered coffee and the breakfast sandwich sausage and spinach. It was the most flavorful breakfast sandwich! Coffee is smooth and delish! Flavorful, fresh, and affordable. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Can't wait to try lunch and wine bar next!
