JJy20s-vJk2r_nH9Gk60ug.text: I visited Pronto twice on a 3 day trip to Las Vegas, which says a lot. The decor, service, and quality of food and drink were the top reasons for my return. The cheese platter was incredible, and the wide variety of wines really paired nicely. I can't wait for my next trip back to try more of the wonderful menu! If you are in Caesars Palace I highly recommend stopping by!

BBRBsKKzKWlHpeHEgFEYlQ.text: Could not pay me to eat there again.  Better yet could not pay me and pay for my dinner to ever eat there again.     To reply to the manager.  The food was stale and the service was lacking.  For the prices I would have thought there was going to be a better food experience from a network food star's business.

WnP2bk7F7LbAXl1XTtEDWg.text: Located inside the Caesars Palace near the Palace Tower where I was staying. Very nice small  cafe. I just got me a pistachio gelato flavor it was good. I wanted other things but it was almost dinner time. Your first check in on yelp you get a free lemon cookie with 3 inside

XKBB-k0CBWBsDvrudKXT4g.text: I am a local and live in Vegas. wanted to go to the restaurant Giada for my birthday lunch but saw they don't open for lunch anymore so we went to try Pronto.  I was really disappointed. I was craving the arugula salad and all they had sitting out was kale salad.  I thought maybe they could make me one but they would not. I feel That If it's on the menu, then I should be able to order it. The cashier was rude and had no personality.  I got the mufaletta instead and the bread is really hard and it wasn't fresh.  Tasted like it was sitting there for a while. I asked for a fresh one and she said it was, but didn't taste like it. It was way better when I had it at the restaurant in the past.  Was overall disappointed and wouldn't go back for food.  The lemon ricotta cookies and chocolate chip cookies are delicious. Bummed I drove to the strip for a good lunch and got an overpriced stale sandwich.

L9nzoPoCgQeaFJRhyjufeQ.text: I had the Antipasti breakfast egg sandwich that was filled with meat and cheese with a tasty bun. Also, if you Yelp check in they give you a free bag of lemon ricotta cookies that are to die for! Quick, easy and tasty!

5iM7j_WWbPumuAp0x4uR-w.text: Super over priced, which is Vegas. However pre made sandwiches that cost $16.... should be made to order. The only redeeming factor is its quick. Other than that, the food is average. Id rather spend the money on a nice restaurant in Vegas than pronto.

PqHvrMUi51Bl2WiHPV3esw.text: Waited 25 min to order, 15 min to get my food.  Seriously.  After my 25 min wait they told me they were out of veggie pritta which was the only thing i could eat being on low carb diet, they relented and got me one likely out of freezer.  They charged me f $5 for can of bubbly, are you kidding me.

Y31v85oHxgzfed5yErURbw.text: Yelp check in and you get amazing cookies that are so soft mine broke.  Great place for a coffee or sandwich. Line moves fast. Well staffed. Located inside Ceasers across from the buffet.  Places to eat, charge your electronics. Im a fan!

XsFQ5-ph-BMLYMlGIhz2bg.text: For a so called up market pastry I was disappointed. I gave a 3 star only because I went there late. 900 pm. Then again they were supposed to be open until 12 midnight. The apple crostata was dry like the Nevada desert, not very tasty. If a store that sells pastries with very long open hours, they should at least bake or thaw out their previously many days old frozen dough 2 times. The food was not cheap and the americano was for 7$ for a small cup.  I am not sure I will be returning any time soon, sorry.

s6jEQ28i6ddD6qZ4Tp7raA.text: Food was good, prices were ridiculously overpriced for what it was! But I guess it's to be expected on the strip, poor tourists

5kd0wiiAyse94QszhpgXRQ.text: Pretty disappointed that this carries Giada's name. Had a turkey bacon avocado panini, which was extremely salty and u enjoyable. I also had a apple crostada. The dough was missing any fat and so was very dry and flaky. The soles look like they had gone through a dehydrator.

_muwOQ26CnGOuDfXOZwzaw.text: super dry & salty for all their sandwiches and they make sure you get high blood pressure heart stroke, ALL their sandwiches are reheated gas station sandwiches hard and burn like a rock plus very salty , you can waste $20 try it and you will learn the lesson if u not listen

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gas station reheat sandwiches hard burned like a rock

niJdZP0KW69RqkOKt5vOzQ.text: Stopped in twice during our stay - first night, got a straight nip Tito's soda, second night, sat for awhile and it's a glass of wine and dessert - pomegranate sorbet and chocolate gelato. Delicious on all counts. Two different bartenders- both were really gracious hosts and servers.

lc0Ir47o3yIEGYHM9mQINw.text: Located inside Caesar's palace, this is the 'fast food' section of Giada.   It was good both times we came in during our last stay.  The line moves quickly as the ladies behind the counter work like a team of busy bees.  The coffee here is delicious!    The one thing I still think about is the delicious Lemon Panini $14.  It's perfectly prepared with cheese and lemon.  One of the those things that you can't wait to eat again.   Panna Cotta was smooth and delicious.   We loved that it wasn't very sweet.   Italian flag cake.   If you like almonds, you'll love this cake.  Just let it sit out of the fridge (where they keep it) before you eat it.  Great place to eat fast food that isn't fried or unhealthy.   There's something for everyone!  Can't wait to come back.

f60VGQj6jSmr8o1NafBKWA.text: on my trip to vegas this was one of the places I wanted to check out. I had a little bit of a hard time finding where it was but thats my own problem haha. I Really liked the mocha and the panini I totally forgot what the croissant thing is called but I loved that. The staff was really nice and the decor was great too.

fRV7qmc91fEgbqQToxCAgg.text: Delicious coffee and they offer dairy substitutes.  Yes!    This coffee roast mix is tastier than Starbucks. It was a perfect grab and go coffee experience. We then headed to the pool with coffee in hand to start the day.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5Jd9bfVSlvWNft7L74YvQg.text: The free lemon cookies with your "check-in" are sooo good! You get 3 cookies, they are lightly forested. They are soft, moist, and super zesty! I really enjoyed them! We also got the tomato and mozzarella salad ($5). It was cool and refreshing! This is a great place for a quick lunch or a sweet treat!

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 Free lemon cookies when you check in!!! They were so refreshing!!

Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eXz8WMueQ8i0oXwT5S6VpQ.text: If you love Giada's Italian cuisine, but have no time, just go to Ceasars Palace and pick some delicious desserts or sandwiches to go.  No reservations required, just a craving.  Packaged sandwiches and salads are available, along with salads and antipasto items from trays in the display.  If you have a sweet tooth, there are many types of gelato and ice creams to choose from, as well as pastries and those lemon basil cookies that are free with a Yelp check-in and purchase.  Being Italian, Giada seems to fit right into Ceasars Palace and enjoys a wonderful history of food and glamour.

Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Gelato

sijfHacjkioaVH4nx1mSyQ.text: I went there with my girlfriends and it was wonderful. They have delicious omelettes, prime rib, chicken and all kinds of salads. Desserts oh my the lemon ricotta cookies unbelievable! Great job Giada

oTWqlHd4d0oDNoUhr_0O7Q.text: We stumbled upon a groupon for a brunch buffet at pronto. It is a differnt buffet experience than most vegas buffets. It is open and selections but the selections were perfect! They had an omelette bar with a great selection of items and a mini fruit/salad bar. The items were fresh and the staff was amazing. If you can. Sit at the bar If you can! George and the waitresses were awesome to talk to! We may come back tomorrow!

1qlsLF2hI7q1rJesHHIqdg.text: Better then traditional fast food chains. It is expensive, but, Vegas in general is expensive. The display case probably shouldn't exist since the food looked old. I was afraid it was the food they were serving but it is not. I kind of expected more but the food was decent. Employees seemed flustered while busy. Food came out at different times. Probably won't come back.

odN__8ID-5kpw_f7kdxArA.text: If you are at a conference and you're so lucky to be in one of the rooms furthest away from food source (like Milano ball room) this is first option.  Meatball soup very salty but good and can with slice of focaccia.  Veg frittata has no flavor and tasted like they nuked it... which they did. $17 worth of chew food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ieYVU7hQh1HMICkQYH-4zA.text: Can't go wrong here.  Can get quick breakfast and the service waa good aa well.  Food tasted pretty good and fast.

2a1cSEwRi4tkot0WwLBeug.text: $7 for a cup of regular coffee. That happened. That's also shocking and disgraceful. No, you don't have to buy it just as I chose not to. Oh, and another thing. So much for saving the environment, if you bring your own cup they will not use it insisting instead on giving you a throwaway cup with a plastic lid. It is 2019, get with the program Giada, Pronto. Sad.

FTpCCqTN9fPCGDUK0gYTNA.text: Love this idea!! Super cool concept extremely smart!! I love how it's simple and has so much still put into the idea and design.. I had the pesto pasta and caprese salad with grilled chicken.. the staff was very nice and they have energy!! They actually talk to you and have personality big plus.. Makes it feel like a real destination!! A very cool thing about this place is it wraps around the corner into a bar setting!! Very sexy looking bar and gift shop follows up at the very end. Two thumbs up and 5 stars ! Congrats !!

_oQ5Na-zubsh1SrIAuzlxA.text: This place is super busy in the morning, but they are very efficient. The oatmeal kinda changed my life to the point where I make it at home now with various fruits. It's oatmeal with olive oil, nuts, and oranges. Sh** is GOOD!   If you check in on Yelp you get lemon ricotta cookies which are suppose to be a signature. Truthfully, they just taste like simple lemon cookies to me. LOL.

k_Jn6e0XPXknpe8auGciwg.text: I reeeeeaally wanted to love this place !! Giada at the Cromwell is spectacular so this was a complete letdown even if it is fast casual. First off it's allllll The way at the end of the Caesars Palace shops. The tables were dirty, the staff was chit chatting and not very helpful. I was over charged and some of the items are way over priced but I think that's a Caesars Palace price point.  I got : lemon ricotta cookies - tasty and pretty fresh for a bag item. $5 and worth it.  Chocolate chip cookies - very yummy and you can taste the quality ingredients. I was charged $5 even though the bag said $3.  Italian Rainbow cake - very moist, almond flavor and pretty to look at. $6  All in all I hope they sort out their kinks and talk to their employees so when I go back in May I can have some of the hot items and salads.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giada would be unhappy with the messy tables
Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty tables and no one cleaned it for 20 mins
Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Display cases of the sandwiches

pcyHwkJvZzQqq5BUBRtvZg.text: Simple Italian cafe kind of menu!    Pizzas and pastas for people on the go or something quick to eat!   Pizza sausage was spot on. Check in on Yelp for complimentary lemon cookies!   Pastas are of the norm.  Standard size and quality is good.    Grab and start munchin'!  I'll like my food Pronto!

p1LhYMw4Q_xwLDF4mt_jBw.text: Pronto, Pronto!! Loved the fast casual Italian breakfast bites with impeccable friendly service. INDULGENT Dolci at its finest will have you coming back for more & price points are fair for Vegas. Bravo Giada you nailed this one.  Ciao

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9I3fNg4csch5-06yi04q8g.text: The lines were long but moved very fast. The cashiers were as attentive as they could be with the amount of people they have in line. The croissants are delicious, the bagel was just alright.  The cannoli however was a big disappointment. The filling had formed a kind of skin and the shell itself was soft which made me think they had been sitting there for quite some time. The cappuccino was made incorrectly and more of a latte then a cappuccino. It was alright, but not phenomenal.

thHAOQWatX-OR1WoYk8WqQ.text: Well, I had high hopes for a quick bite from Giada. Not to be. I got the lobster roll and in the first bite there were four pieces of shell. That hurt my teeth and cut my gums. I returned it and asked for a muffuletta to replace it. Both sandwiches were very cold. They keep them in a cooler but I thought they were just too cold. I got the bean salad which was actually very nice. So one star for that.   My wife got a salad with chicken which she said was just ok. She also ordered the meatball soup which was like tomato sauce with tiny meatballs in it. Not great either.   We finished with the black and white cookies which were also just ok. Disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

B_gL0x3bajf7BP8Zo9y4Bg.text: Really enjoyed dining for brunch at Pronto by Gilda. The omelet station chef was fantastic and the dessert options sinful!

zf8QrWbzrrNRUP4C_4oJiA.text: Pricey, but very good selection. The smoothies are $9, but some of the healthiest options in the food court area of Caeser's. The gelato is a must, and reasonable at $4.50 a scoop (considering). Good people watching tables, and a nice break from gambling.  There's also a bar with fantastic wine and small bites. A real treat!

UH757QJHiZiH6j8FTWsbcg.text: Considering that Giada is a celebrity chef, you'd think anything with her name on it would be excellent. At least I would. My wife and I ordered the chocolate chip cookies, a piece of mascarpone cheesecake and a Nutella eclair. Flavorless is really the only way to describe it. The cookies were nothing more than average. The eclair was actually hollow. There were slight traces of Nutella, but nothing close to being full of Nutella like you would expect in an eclair. As far as the cheesecake is concerned, the cheesecake at the Cheesecake Factory a short walk away is exponentially better.  Very disappointing.

-Yfkv9rSqLXeLDTiZX_p4w.text: If you want food Pronto but doesn't taste good, then you come to the right place. We paid over $36 for 2 breakfast sandwiches and hashbrowns to be quickly reheated and served. Cold and rubbery hash browns, enidible bread, the tiniest pieces of sauage, and luke warm eggs, is not my idea for a nice warm breakfast sandwich. Horrible food quality.  Do yourself a favor, save your money and head over to McDonald's or Einstein Bagels for a better breakfast experience.

M2OebUY0fXEc6vsx48TSKw.text: We've come here for snacks twice now.  Lemon basil gelato is deliciously refreshing! The appearance may be off-putting to some as you can see the pieces of basil... it honestly looks like it was dropped in some grass, however it tastes way better than grass, promise!  The vegetable frittata is a tiny portion for the price, although with this place being located in a casino, that's not surprising. It was also forgettable as there wasn't anything special or unique about the flavour. It's nice if you need something quick for breakfast.  The everything bagel was surprisingly good. It had a strong toasted garlic flavour, which is awesome because I absolutely loooove garlic! The portion of cream cheese is small as you only get a tiny container of Philadelphia cream cheese. It was not enough for the entire bagel... definitely could have used two of those containers!  The free lemon ricotta cookies with yelp check-in are a nice touch. Nothing to blow your socks off but they are pretty tasty! Overall, a nice place to grab a quick bite to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon basil gelato

DyDHQ7l0rh0cO7XBFhNuWQ.text: I was determined to give this cafe a try because I have heard really good things about it. I decided to try one of their sandwiches, a delicious looking hazelnut/Nutella eclair and an iced americano. To tell you the truth, everything was decent, probably slightly above average (hence the 4 stars), but for the price you pay, none of my ordered items were anything impressive. It's a regular sandwich cafe with some desserts and drinks. I walked there from Paris hotel and it wasn't worth it :D I actually don't get the hype about this place.   There is another Giada dinner place at Cromwell hotel (opened recently). I am going to give it a try soon and hoping it will be better :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jLgxojFYg79o7zKZ57OKKw.text: We have been here at least five times for brunch. The buffet is outstanding. Antonia is the best waitress ever and spoils us!!   We will eat here every time we come to Vegas, it's that good!

Spex0bcesVWb2eFapP5Wjg.text: I ordered the pesto grilled cheese aka panini. It was literally a white bread roll with a thick helping of pesto-y cheese. And it was $13. I get that it's Vegas  therefore expensive but come on. Won't be coming back.

K7tpx-mgDRS6mffDZ0AdWA.text: Amazing food, Brandon was super helpful and very friendly!  We really appreciated his customer service!

UTfkAZMnK1TaMY2cBTIxaQ.text: Mixed berry panna cota is superb. Nailed it in taste profile and texture is smooth and creamy. Sweetness not overpowering. $5   Thanks yelp for the lemon cookies for free too!

Jm9hBV_u9FkIr-_5ArorZQ.text: 'Eh. $19 for a tiny panini and a 20 ounce soda. The panini was good but each half was smaller than my hand.  Expensive and small food.   Good location, right at the bottom of the escalator below the convention space.

ROrM4hGAsymfl4Amvgo-Tw.text: $5 americano - it's a bit much. It's good though. They should offer a Venti size - for $6 maybe - I would definitely pay for that.  I got the breakfast sandwich too - was quite tasty and super filling. Big, unique bread, lots of meat. Giada charges you for it but she delivers good flavor. Checked in and got some cookies too. Not bad for a quick meal!

okO0zQWtJ31D4B5o1YdCMw.text: My husband and I went there for a quick breakfast. I ordered a frittata and hash browns and my husband had  a breakfast sandwich and hash browns.  It was terrible. The frittata was like rubber and hash browns were hard as a rock!   My husband sandwich was not edible and hash browns disgusting.  This was $38.00.   The employees could have cared less!  Do not go there.

Ycd4pBENJByy5VqDEWaoNw.text: Hubby and I usually stay at Caesar's when visiting Las Vegas.  They never really had a great place to grab a quick bite for breakfast, until now.  I heard that Giada opened an express type of place so hubby and I were excited to check it out.  They have a great variety of foods to choose from.  Pastries, sandwiches, yogurt, fruit, salads, cakes, smoothies.  OMG, the breakfast sandwiches are delish!  Hubby ordered the Antipasti Breakfast Sandwich which had egg, bacon, prosciutto, mortadella, piquillo pepper mascarpone, and provolone.  It was a pretty big sandwich served warmed on a brioche bun.  He also ordered a side of hashbrowns that were crispy and seasoned with salt, pepper, and Italian seasoning.  I had a bagel w/cream cheese.  It was decent, not as good as NY LOL, but still good. We also shared a strawberry & cream cheese danish.  It was good, really flaky, but the strawberry filling tasted more like jam than fresh strawberries.  Which is still good, just not what I expected.    Don't forget to check in on Yelp.  You get a free package of lemon ricotta cookies that are seriously to die for.

t_ZhUYVbH43hJSDIdJfI4Q.text: I only wish we would have had time to try the morning brunch! It looked delicious!  It will be on our go to list for next

_8l7TQRc_QO0P8ne_SyboQ.text: Ham and apple panini was a bit bland. Pass on the lemon cookies, way way too sweet. Probably won't return, a bit disappointed.

v9KWpGRp-nzVcnPaJlqHeA.text: I just recently got employed at Caesars Palace - more excitingly, that meant more food options I've never tried before. This gem is right by my department and finally decided to make this my first food stop in the Empire. I had ordered the chicken detox soup and it was absolutely delicious. Vegas has been going through a cold spell lately and this is exactly what I needed to keep me toasty. Top it off, again, ridiculously good.  Besides soup, they have big sandwiches (like really good looking sandwiches), various salads, snacks, coffee, ICE CREAM.... ANNNNNND the size of their sliced cheesecake, oh my goodness. It is not no one bite slice! [Just sayin']  I will be making this AT THE LEAST a once a week stop! Highly recommend.

Fa2nGdqGL24DEBGZAh-2fw.text: Went to grab lunch and eat it poolside...Had roasted veggies, and broccoli. So delicious!! Wanting something light, and it the perfect dish for that!! Staff was helpful, and efficient. Got through the line quickly.   Also had breakfast there.. coffee was delicious and hot!! My husband had a frittata...he enjoyed it!   Pronto is new to the Caesar since my last visit. The perfect addition!! Loved it! Will be back!! Oh, loved the "I speak Giada" shirts!!!

JDU5dcJIoHwFG8wJn-WJZg.text: Visited Pronto on my first trip to Vegas. Since Giada is a favorite celebrity chef of mine I couldn't pass it up. Upon entering I was surprised to see the cannolis prefilled, I hate soft cannoli shells. So I opted for the dark chocolate marscapone cake. My server was happy to assist me, she grabbed my wife's Sin City cookie first while I was still at the register. A supervisor approached and asked me where I seen the cake so I pointed to the menu. Apparently the menu is just for show, and the showcase is available items. So I complete my order of 1 cookie, 1 dark chocolate cream puff, and 1 small chocolate gelato. I unhappily paid the near $20 price to a very confused cashier and took a seat to enjoy our celebrity chef selection. My wife loved her cookie. After her first bite my daughter complained that the chocolate gelato was mint chocolate. My wife's takes a bite and confirms, then I second it with a bite. So I go back to the counter and ask the supervisor if the chocolate gelato should be marked Mint Chocolate. He goes over and looks at the name card and says that it's chocolate and the only mint they carry is a dark chocolate mint which they don't currently have and wishes me a good day. I finished the mint chocolate gelato and gave my daughter the cream puff. I'm very disappointed in the quality of service and taste  of the desserts. So glad that I don't get treated this way back home!

KV7i3J8eD5EBvgBexosrAg.text: Thoroughly disappointed in the food. I ordered the citrus salmon and it was not only dry but also lacked any flavor the only reason I gave this place 2 stars is due to the fact that the sides were actually halfway decent. Overall I can easily say this was probably the worst food that I have had on the Las Vegas strip

AsXpj9GdVPoOf-NuV3GufQ.text: First time Giada's in Ceasar's Got the Turkey club, first bite I must have said Ummmmm out loud the gal next to me smiled.  Great food.

Xn9cRQjD3wLH9AK3Uv9zvw.text: Yummy panini sandwich and baked sausage manicotti.  Checked in on Yelp and received complimentary lemon ricotta cookies!

nKYepBdRbLeGilri0IQ_ZA.text: I bought one of their grab and go item - California Chopped Salad with Grilled Shrimp - and it is really good ! Beyond my expectation ! All the veggies on top of the salad including corn, tomato and zucchini have an nice grilled flavor. And those 2 big and juicy grilled shrimp really made my day. I didn't have the dressing so not sure it's taste, but everything else was already good by themselves. Glad I bought this salad for lunch !

7GNUOdBpWyore0daOPKy2g.text: Fast, attentive service. I loved the decor and flow too. Looking forward to going back and take advantage of wine deal at their cool bar

FIwylt5Ah5wyg_FOg_gUaA.text: Giada has done it again! I ordered Ham, Gruyere & Apple Panini, Caprese Salad, and Strawberry Smoothie. They were all so delicious. I mean what does she put in that smoothie to make it so tasty?  I guess we will never know....#secretrecipe LOL Sorry - totally forgot to take a pic of the smoothie, was too busy enjoying it. Cannot wait to visit again!

u5ejpnO6h1tU4IGIm2XPqA.text: Great lunch place,  amazing cookies - I tried the lemon ones and chocolate chip, you can get them to go,  would definitely come back for the cookies alone!  Love Giada, she's great! This place is neat the front of Cesears.

o1sJaRS7LH7ApKsTI2lmTg.text: Very curteous service and the caprese sandwich and lemon cookies were so good. I wish I had time to come back and try some other things.

or8IaRqnjc7Tf1MW1gfvgA.text: Wine bar .. wonderful!! Very casual but classy .. enjoyed a wine  flight and coconut chocolate sorbet yummy  bartender was attentive and friendly

LDs2c7NzVyxQwsDVni---g.text: I've eaten at Pronto everyday since I've been here. When I first arrived I order the bacon wrap, pasta salad to lemon tart. The tart was a little to zesty for me. The next time I went back I got the pasta salad and lemon cake.

avAblokk9LrACsU7YiHK6Q.text: Yummy lemon cookies! Stopped in for brunch and was delighted that I could have rose and not just Prosecco! Wonderful antipasto and again the lemon cookies!

dGRxB8an3Ca-L9NP_UKg-Q.text: Got the hazelnut Eclair and lemon cookies both were very very good. Everything looked delicious and fresh can't wait to go back and try one of their breakfast sandwiches

dX6GSp9mlOsTcpkWUzPFdw.text: This was a pretty cool place in caesars palace. Good selections of wine and spirits! The bar food was super yummy. The Formaggi Board was amazing. The house made orange marmalade and strawberry tomato jam was banging. The goat cheese stuffed sweet peppers with olive tamponade was also amazing. The service was on point never waited for a thing!

iuwUIw4jzTupW5KCmFA4Cg.text: I will only review what I ordered. It was very disappointing. I ordered Americano coffee (medium 12 oz ), sausage frittata, panini caprese and a small cup of water (free, but for a larger cup you get charged a dollar).  The Coffee needs cream or milk or sugar  to balance the bitterness and the acidity. The sausage frittata was dry and very salty. The panini caprese was dry  and over cooked . The bread was hard , needs tomato ( there was only one thin slice of tomato that covered barely half of the sandwich).  Cheese was ok. It was just a panini with cheese (can't see or taste the basil) & a tiny bit of tomato.  Guiada's reataurant is highly rated and receives raving reviews. For her name to be associated with food that I will rate as below MacDonald's breakfast, is not what I expected. I am assuming that a lot of the breakfast selections are pre made. But I will not settle for food that sacrifices taste even if the price is reasonable. Now, there are other selections- salads, cupcakes, cookies, gelato and sorbet. They look wonderful and appetizing and according to the menu, one can order wine and  other alcoholic beverage.  I will leave that for  others  to review.

47N8UBP16HDlF7UIPCNvgA.text: A very casual coffee spot with lots of choices. The staff was very knowledgeable of their products and highly recommend this place to anyone.

QEUe18qL_GIxeR2W8O3W9A.text: Nice little quaint spot to stop by grab a cappuccino and chill out. Loved the ambiance and the coffee was great! A great place for a quick bite. Will definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas!

fpDOabF-LlBO4eM6e0goRQ.text: The place was absolutely fantastic! Fast, friendly service! The Tuscan Steak was unbelievable. Don't get to Vegas a lot but will definitely be back on next visit!

5Zg5M070OB-1mwF1A-v3fA.text: George was amazing! My sister and I popped in for a lil treat ... two different girls with different wine tastes ... George selected two perfect wines!!  What  to talk with as well!

s2I3vOIxm2Rq-uq7rhnWMw.text: Went there for late dinner.  Ordered the soup, so salty.  Next day, went to try the gelato, ... can easily find some place better.  Both times, the workers there just don't want to work.

oLSg59qgvBhiolqAaY08aA.text: The Lemon Ricotta Cookies are absolutely delish! Even if your tastebuds prefer sweetness over tart, you won't be disappointed. Its sweet enough that the tart is not overwhelming. The Black & White cookies are the best! Her take is the lemon ricotta cookies with chocolate & white chocolate frosting. It's a must!

SbxEXhInkcbyJ9H9z2wWgw.text: The chocolate cake was absolutely phenomenal. So decadent and rich. The cheesecake however was not as good. Disappointing. However, the manager I think his name was Ryan, gave me a complimentary Nutella puff pastry to make up for it. What a great guy! I also had their egg sandwich with ham and bacon with egg bun. Delicious! Pronto is a great concept from Giada! Well done!

Zg8aZdoigAPxZRUww6CHWw.text: I love me some Giada. But this place is a little overpriced for pre-prepped food. The food is OK not what you would expect from Giada. She is clearly taking a vantage of the fact that this is Vegas and people will just pay for whatever you give them. But if you want to give them anything, G. Give them good food at a good price! Insanely expensive and not the freshest. Save your coins!

u-AwYnftvFE4gGN5He5o3g.text: Very happy with ice coffee and the chocolate ice was to die for. Also redeem the coupon for our first time here and they were amazing !!! Definitely we be stopping here again.

rELqocqbMf_bZ0WACgjwlA.text: Lemon ricotta cookies were a little too sweet. Pineapple kale smoothie was good as well as the oatmeal. Wish they had more vegan / vegetarian options listed in the menu.

OW6DwaSTKol401O8RMn3Jg.text: The lemon cookies were great.  The frittata was small and tasted okay; nothing you couldn't get a Whole Foods.  The cappuccino was y'all size and over priced.

ln4izojg0GpTTeLA1tuWMg.text: Being a Las Vegas local, I've stopped by a few times and have never been disappointed. I love the ham and cheese panini as a go to, but if I'm ever not in the mood they have chicken and veggies that are pretty good as well. The staff is all super nice, and if you're not sure what to order they'll point you in the right direction. Also, be sure to swing by the store they have attached on the other side...they're got super cute kitchen stuff!

DmvfqJzhrL4Lt4c4ToTZ5w.text: I forgot this had open, so that alone was a nice surprise on my stay at Ceasars. Unfortunately I wasn't pleased with it. My husband had the lobster roll which I thought was pricey for something that was already "pre-made" but it was the better sandwich out of the two we had. I ordered the artichoke tuna and it was too salty for my taste. So I ended up eating some of his lobster roll. I also ordered the iced mocha latte and that was fine. Reading everyone else's review I should of went to the Cromwell to experience better food.

e1dFDDiVgusRLsS9MBkf7g.text: Love! We needed a break from walking so we stopped to get dessert and coffee. PERFECT for a mid day coffee stop... I ordered the iced mocha and tiramisu, the husband wanted something more so he  ordered a lobster roll and a veggie goat cheese panini. The portions are the perfect for lunch and Service was quick and friendly. It's right across from the buffet.

k31beKattLLeEqM8VUEVVA.text: They weren't very busy.  Order of one panini and one salad was taking a long time. I approached counter person who got the chef de cuisine to come forward. He was very nice. We just explained that we watched many orders come up before ours. We were standing right at the counter, yet no one noticed they we hadn't gotten our food yet.  Poor attention to their customers. Ultimately, our food was handed to us in five minutes. We were offered a refund but we used players points and told them nevermind.    Very tasty sandwich and salad.

XWef7knXfcB6LYFWViCITQ.text: We've gone every morning to Pronto by Giada. I realize there are mixed reviews and I'm biased because I love her but overall the coffee and food are great. Yes, everything is a little pricey but that's Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hjTJKiSUbxvkhBhZ0UDDkw.text: The Cookies where delicious I was disappointed I couldn't check in when I was there my internet didn't work. It was one of the best lemon ricotta cookies I ever had.   *****After giving my review I got home I found out  one of my order was missing and I was charged for it. Try to call the cafe they didn't have phone in there only at the gift shop.  Left a massage for manager to call me back cause the lady I talk to couldn't help me.  That's the most disappointing of all.  And live in Ca.

j32Mb-pUL4pGFnWPAUCLMg.text: Had delicious glass of Sangiovese and tasty Salumi board recommended by the knowledgeable and friendly Drea! So fun at the Giada Wine Bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pronto by Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BpJe0C8wNRrMkLZBOMUQsQ.text: The Wine Bar at Pronto by Giada was great! Wine selection and bar bites paired well together. We had the Chardonnay, Rose and Salumi board. Drea was our hostess and was very knowledgable and made us feel welcome. Weill definitely be coming back!

_A-QfG7fHsNT3bormY4aqQ.text: I love the concept - great for a quick lunch or meeting. The wine list has to be one of the best in town and I love that you can choose your pour size!

vN8pTSm-QsQi4lxXqoWrYw.text: Two words....lemon cookies. This review is solely based on Giada's Lemon Ricotta cookies and I think Pronto deserves 5 stars no matter what anything else tastes like. If you like a rich lemon cookie, you have to try these. I can't wait to go back and get some more.
